text: This is my favorite breakfast place in town and it never fails me.  Service is always top notch.  I like sitting at the counter watching the food come out.  If you feel like indulging, try the Monte Cristo. Its a turkey, ham, and swiss sammy in french toast batter deep fried.  Dipped in syrup and you're in heaven!!  If you feel like a healthier option, go for the Veggie Benny.  Avocado, spinach, grilled tomatoes, two poached eggs smothered in hollandaise.  One of the best benedicts I've ever had!
If you're looking for a great cafe off strip, I highly recommend The Cracked Egg. Excellent service, prices are commensurate with the quality and quantity of food.
Great breakfast spot! Casual atmosphere and good food. Veggie Benny is YUM!

What's not to like about this local b'fast spot. Walked in and it was busy (+). Got seated right away and the server, Alice, could not have been nicer or more attentive from start to finish. I made a few adjustments to a menu item - which she accommodated without a blink. Service was brisk, refills often and prices fair.  She also recommended the homemade (and served warm) coffee cake instead of toast - bonus round. I like that they only do b'fast and lunch and shut it down at 2pm (weekdays) - stick with what you know and do it well.
This breakfast spot is out of my way but I don't mind making the drive because the food and coffee are amazing. I love their California omelet and their breakfast potatoes! Definitely worth trying!!

Come here every time we visit Vegas! The gluten free breakfast options are amazing. Emily was our server this time. She was exceptional. We came yesterday and told her we would be back today. She remembered our drink order and what she had suggested we try the day before. She is so friendly and personable and her suggestions were great! Thank you Emily!

Was pretty disappointed with this place.  My aunt had been raving about this place so maybe my hopes were too high.  Prices were a little much.  6.75 for 2 eggs, toast, and a small coffee.  I ordered the French Toast and a chocolate milk.  The toast was soggy, even the crust.  The chocolate milk tasted like hershey's syrup mix but watered down.  I also tried a couple bites of the huevos rancheros which actually wasn't too bad.  flavors were very bold and quite yummy.  The only thing is that it lacked texture and just felt like mush in your mouth.  Service was good; timely and waitresses were friendly.  I'd probably check this place out again to try something else that would hopefully change my view of this place, but very sparingly considering the prices.
Great place for brunch! Eggs Benedict were great, as was the peanut butter French toast. Service was also great!

First time eating here was a grate choice. Im loving the admosfier here. My server at the counter was great service with a smile loving her positive energy coming from her. Getting to injoye El Vaquero Omlete with season potatoes yummy :)
I'll defiantly will be coming back with friends and family.

Love this place the coffe cake is so good I always come back for a slice.

The service was great at first but towards the end it could have used a little work. The manager is great though he was running food and helping with tables overall I will cone back again.

Out-of-towner's first visit.

After the debacle that was our dinner at a downtown buffet the night before, we were particularly hoping for a good breakfast. The man-child picked out this location after looking online.
 
Bright and clean - we only waited about 10 min for a table.
Hostess friendly. Someone stopped by right away and took our drink orders. The server came by very soon after that to make sure our drinks had been ordered and since we were first-timer's gave us time to make our selections. 

Food came quickly.

I can't remember exactly what I had - something in a skillet - potatoes and eggs. Yum. Coffeecake - good but very rich and more suited to a dessert. Man-child had no problem assisting me by eating 2/3rds of it.. He had an omelette and kept saying "I don't usually eat omelettes but this is good!"

He already sees a return visit in his future during our next trip to Vegas.

The North shore omelet is my favorite, and the service is excellent. A little pricey for breakfast, but worth it. For a 3 egg omelet it was huge, seemed like they must have used pterodactyl eggs. Everything was perfect, great way to start your day!

The server was friendly and attentative.  Food is good.  They made the crispy hash brown just the way I liked it.  My coffee cup wasn't empty for long as they made sure I had enough.  The place is clean including the restroom which is a food sign.
Nice place for lunch or breakfast. Has the enchilada omelette and it was great. Service was excellent also
They should really make this place 24 hours, cause I would be here all the time! The eggs are real and not powered and the pancakes is bomb!!
Had a great breakfast here.  I'd definitely go back.  The patio was nice and my Carnitas Omelet was very good.  My server was cheerful and all smiles and our coffees were topped off often.

I love breakfast and I love not having to cook breakfast. So I really love breakfast places and this is one of my favorites. I used to go here once a week on my way to class when I had more time and money but now I am reduced to going whenever I get a chance. But every time is great.

I love their scrambles and their build your own skillet options. But when I go with the skillet I end up picking too many ingredients and spending more money than I want. The scrambles they have are great especially the southside scramble. 

The staff is usually really friendly and I get my food within 15 minutes of sitting down (if I know what I want when I sit down). Which is ideal for a quick breakfast when you do not have much time.

Came here with Steven during our vay-cay in Vegas. Again, found out about this place thru Yelp, starving for something to eat for breakfast after over-sleeping. And again, Yelp did not fail us!

There were lots of reviews complaining about over-crowding and the place being uncomfortably jammed packed, but we didn't have that problem at all! Perhaps it was cause we came on a Tuesday morning? Anyways, wouldn't the fact that it's supposedly always crowded fact that it's a popular/awesome place to eat? I would think so!

Anyways, the food: GREAT. I ordered a Tropical French Toast while the bf got the Southwestern Scramble. Shredded coconut + macadamia pieces + bananas +french toast = freakin awesome! With the coconut and the macadamia, you really don't even need the syrup or butter! The Southwestern Scramble was delicious as well: Omelet with cheese and other yummy goodness, seasoned potatoes and sausages.  In the words of one of my friends, "anything southwestern is good!" And I totally agree! I also got some protien in the form of some turkey sausage patties, or was it chicken? I don't remember, but it was yummy too =]

All in all, I wish this place existed closer to home!
Cracked Egg was just in the Review Journal for having one of the best Monte Cristo's in Vegas and it is delicious! :)

Today after church I went to have lunch with my family. Knew exactly what to order, pesto scramble, yum! Everyone's meal was delicious, expected! The service was a blessing to us. Thank you to our waitress, Tracy, for your warm smile and infectious happy attitude! Love coming here!

This place is usually pretty busy even during the week. However, its worth the wait. The menu has lots of tasty choices and is sure to please. I ordered the Denver omelet with breakfast potatoes and toast. The breakfast potatoes here are the best! The food was hot, fresh, and delicious. 

The staff could have been more attentive. Our waiter was all over the place and rarely came to check on us granted, they were quite busy. The portions are nice, not too overwhelming. The prices are fair. 

Definitely, a great place for a laid back breakfast/brunch.

This is by far my favorite breakfast place in Vegas. I usually go with a half skillet or the benedict both are delicious. Make sure to try the coffee cake they have different flavors daily and all are amazing!

They are educated about Gluten and do their very best to reduce the chance for cross contamination. Ask for the GF menu. Those that don't have to eat GF were in love with their meals too! I will eat here every time I am in Vegas!!!

This place is always a treat when I can find time to get there. My best advice? Always get the daily coffee cake!! They really know coffee cake! Overall, I just really like breakfast places so when I can find a place with outdoor seating and a really good vibe, which Cracked Egg has, I tend to keep going back.

The service is always great and for the amount of people they bring in on the weekends when I go there, food comes out pretty quick!

If you come and there is a wait, it's worth it.

Love this place for breakfast.  As a recent transplant to Vegas (last year), I found this local spot and have been here almost a dozen times.  

First and foremost, the 3 things that bring me back are the the coffee cake, the service and the food.  The Coffee Cake is perfection..  I've had at least 4 different kinds and they're all great (although the mocha/chocolate flavor is my favorite).  Lemon and the berry flavors are great as well.  The service here is wonderful as well.  Everyone working here is very friendly, fast and very helpful.

The skillets are really good.  I get the veggi skillet and add bacon.  The Pesto Scramble is also a family favorite (egg whites only).  Half-portions on the breakfasts are available too, so I would suggest a half-size or sharing for the lighter eaters.  

A definite favorite of mine so don't miss it!

I truly love this place. Such an awesome find. I make it a point to bring all out of town guests here because I think it's that good. It get's crowded on weekends, but I'm assuming that's because of how awesome it is. While I don't really stray to far from my "north shore scramble",what I have tasted otherwise has been great as well. Staff is friendly and parking is always pretty easy as well. I enjoy when it gets a little warmer and I can sit outside, but inside is always fine as well. Will definitely be back, again and again and again.
This was a great place, love the logo!!!! And the breakfast food was amazing!!! Glad we hit this spot for sure!!!!
the food is average tasting. i think the food is ok they dont give free refills and gives a small amount of juice

Wow! Glad I found this place off the strip, was not disappointed. From the moment we walked in the staff was very nice and friendly. Service was great and our food came fast. I ordered the Monte Cristo with seasoned potatoes and it was amazing! 

Some meals come with toast or coffee cake options, go with the coffee cake ;)

One of my favorite breakfast spots. I love their scrambles but my favorite thing is the warm coffee cake. The piece is pretty big so I usually share with on of my daughters. 

Service is always excellent. But it's a busy place so be prepared to wait. The portions are smaller than egg works but still a good size

This was my first time here. The food is good but not sure it was worth the wait after Ashely the manager was rude. So took away from the experience of coming here. The waitress we had was knowledgeable about the menu and very nice and even apologized for her mistake but didn't realize she couldn't make substitutions on the menu for simple cottage cheese. 
It's too bad a place like this has a manager with poor customer service and people skills.
About as solid diner food as you can get. Everything I've gotten here has been solid, if a bit overpriced. Nonetheless, I go there regularly.

The Cracked Egg is awesome! A small group of us came here for breakfast and were not disappointed. The food is GREAT and the portions are generous. I would recommend the Cracked Egg to anyone who lives or visits the Las Vegas area.

They rock. Their food is awesome, especially also if you have a gluten intolerance.
Erin is the best!! We always ask to sit in her section when we come. Speedy, friendly service and hands down the most delicious breakfast in town. Yum!!

We come to Vegas several times a year. Love going to The Cracked Egg for their gluten free pancakes. Wish I could pick this restaurant up and move them to Oregon. Love the outdoor seating too. The one on Green Valley doesnt't have that feature.

This is an updated review for a previous review of 5 stars. Now don't get me wrong is till love Cracked Egg and have continued to be loyal to this great breakfast spot. I'm taking 2 stars off because of the service we get when we arrive and when we leave. If the older woman up front was more friendly upon arrival and when leaving maybe I wouldn't feel the way I do. It's such a shame! Such a great establishment and yet tainted by something as simple as greeting and saying goodbye. I understand at times it gets hectic and busy, you may lose your temper but you shouldn't make your guests feel like a burden when they ask to sit outside. You obviously have a patio and people are clearly sitting outside. Being in the industry I understand how frustrating customers can get but it's our job to give a great experience to keep them coming back. We've been coming here for over a year now and are the lowest of low maintenance when it comes to eating here. We know what we want, get in and get out. Foods great, waiters are great it's the leaving experience and coming experience that gives me a bad taste in my mouth :/ although I appreciate the nice gentleman who came by our table and apologized for not being able to accommodate our requests, even though it wasn't his fault, thank you good sir!
Just went to this establishment and I was asked to leave by a patron because of my hat. The manager allowed it good for them

I had the huevos rancheros and boy were they delicious.  The carnitas that they served with them were delicious, and the green sauce (probably tomatillo) that topped them and the beans was delicious as well.  They also have old school shredded hash browns!  I was so excited about this, you rarely see them anymore, usually it's now breakfast potatoes, which I'm not a big fan of.  The hash browns were great, crispy on the outside and smooth/fluffy on the inside, delicious!  The service here was good too; I was doing a working breakfast and my waitress was nice enough to only stop by a couple of times outside of taking my order and delivering my food and then clearing.  Overall, I would say if you want a solid and tasty breakfast here would be a good place to go.
Came here for late breakfast while visiting my BFF. The food was amazing, the portions were huge and the staff was friendly! Such a cute place! I wish we had something like this in NY.. Hint, hint!

Every time I go to Vegas I have to eat breakfast here at least once. The Cracked Egg is hands down the best breakfast I have ever had. Everything on the menu is fantastic but I always get The Bacon Cheeseburger Skillet! Sometimes there is a little bit of a wait but the food and the service is definitely worth it.

I have been coming to this location since 2005 and have always had great service! There are a variety of choices to pick from and the food is always good. We always try to pick Liz's section as she is nice and always remembers our order! Great breakfast and lunch place!

A gluten free diner's gem in Las Vegas! This place was SO good that we went to 2 out of their 4 locations while on vacation over the weekend. 

We stopped by this location on the first day and the service was fast and friendly and I was impressed at how familiar with gluten-free dining my server was. I also loved that they have a separate gluten free menu which you can request.

SO many gluten free breakfast options! Choose from scrambles, to omelettes, skillets and gluten-free pancakes. On my visit here I was so excited for all of these options that I ordered a bit too much food so beware, the portions are quite large.

At this location I tried the Southwest Scramble which consisted of eggs, chorizo, green peppers, pickled jalapenos, onions and a side of salsa. All eggs come with a side of hash browns or seasoned potatoes and gluten free toast! I was glad the server (as well as the menu) mentioned that the bread was toasted in a non-gluten-free toaster; however they will happily grill it for you to avoid contamination. The scramble was super tasty but the hash browns stole the show - perfectly seasoned and crispy! 

I also ordered two gluten-free pancakes and they were excellent - large, fluffy and a little crispy on the edges - could not tell they were gluten free!

My husband who does not have any dietary restrictions also loved this place, especially since they serve you a huge chunk of warm, delicious coffee cake with your eggs! I was jealous but was more than elated with my own meal.

Will most definitely return here if ever in Vegas again - especially since I saw that they also have gluten free lunch options such as burgers and sandwiches.
This place was wonderful.   The food was great and our hostess was so nice.  After a long night on the strip, a good breakfast like this really hit the spot.

I've been coming here for a long time. I always receive excellent service, happy workers, and they're all so very sweet and genuine. 

Food is BOMB :)

I usually get the croissant egg sandwich thingy (can't think of the name for some reason) and occasionally a coffee cake. 


Pros:
Great coffee (not so common)
The best customer service
Excellent food
Nice place 
Can eat inside or out 

Cons:
Can't think of any. :) the wait usually isn't more than 10 minutes.

Great, friendly service, eggcellent menu selection and hands down the best coffee cake I've ever eaten. This was a great decision. I ordered the GVP and my girlfriend got the French toast. I'm coming back for sure!

Awesome place! So glad I found this gem. The egg's Benedict is to die for; everything is cooked perfectly and is as fresh as can be! Quick service even when they're crazy busy and the whole staff is amazing. I love this place. Having breakfast and lunch or perhaps even brunch every Saturday & Sunday now. Tell your friends!

It is very difficult to get excellent Eggs Benedict anywhere.  These were second only to my own.  The eggs were poached perfectly and the hollandaise was thick but smooth with no congeling.  Service was good.  Clean environment.  A little pricey but worth it. I will be returning.  Thank you for a great meal.
Every time I'm in LV I come here!!! They have THE best brunch food!!!!! It's clean and the customer service is great!!!!!

OMG! is all i have to say.  I treated my boyfriend to a get away for his bday to Vegas this past weekend and i picked this place and Im glad I did. the Cracked Egg is way better than Ihop and Denny's put together. the breakfast was like being at home without being at home.

We have been there for several times since we have good experience there.  But this Saturday   we went for lunch and encountered an unprofessional and impolite host who is a young and a little fat girl wearing brown hoodie. 

When my young kid and I was waited to be seated for a time ( busy time), a couple came in and waited behind us.   The host served the couple very quickly but the couple noticed us in front of them, so they told host that we should be served before them.  So we stepped froward and smiled.  What surprised us was she replied us:"  I  saw them first."  Then she ignored us and took the couple to one of the few empty booth.   So we had to wait another couple of minutes to be seated.  She didn't have any explanation or apology for inconvenience.  Even we finished the meal and paid at the counter where she also were the cashier.  She was accepted our payment without any smile or 'thank you' words, like we owed her money and didn't want customers to come again.   

She is the only worst server in this restaurant or we wont go many times.   Before that the host was an lady with a white hair  who is warm and friendly, we were very satisfied with the service. I have the hospitality master degree and know that the host is very important since they make customers the first impression toward the restaurant.  I hope the manager could pay attention to this young host, I really don't want just one person lower the whole service quality of the restaurant.   Hope it could be better.

If one of my friends was reading this post, she would immediately know my identity.  This place is my all time favorite breakfast nook.  I call it the crack house.  (Okay parents, just sensor me.  I don't write for kids.  Just have your kids read Dr. Seus' Green Eggs and Ham.)  This crack house is extremely addictive.   I don't even know where to begin.  These house potatoes are so delicious.  It's size, seasoning and crispy is just yummieee.   My favorite dish is the eggs benny.  The balance and quality of the ingredients creates such a perfect harmony.  Another favorite thing here is the coffee cake.  It's a different cake all time.  It's fresh, piping hot and intoxicating!  To bad most men aren't like that.  - Uh, did I go off topic again? -M2
Wow...is all I can say. Their Gluten Free Blueberry Pancakes are out of this world delicious. I can't wait to drive back to Vegas just to eat these pancakes!
This place doesnt dissapoint, service is always good, and food is delicious. This is our go to breakfast spot in vegas!

This place was sheer perfection. We were hopping from Las Vegas to Tahoe and wanted a quick breakfast bite off the 95. What a find! Their gluten free options were plentiful- clearly they have taken a thoughtful approach here. My partner had a meaty green chile eggs situation - and was in heaven. Their service was all round great and our waiter was especially sweet. We wound up ordering gluten free sandwiches for our long road trip ahead too. Thank you cracked egg- we will crack a smile when we remember you!
One of my favorite breakfast spots! Busy one weekend but wait goes by fast. Stuffed raspberry French toast is my favorite. Customer service is great too.

The staff is super awesome!  This is a family friendly place with good food.  The portion sizes are generous.  They also have a gluten-free menu, not items but a whole menu!!!! The gluten free pancakes are really good!

Awesome breakfast place. Dineresqu feeling and I have been looking for a good breakfast sandwich in the area that can compete with my New England breakfast sandwiches. The breakfast sandwich on a croissant was delicious and just what I was looking for. They also give huge portions which is always great! A little pricey but I'll deal with it.
Great service and delicious food.  When you can, order that cordon bleu pan.  Tried it and it was amazing.  I am never unhappy walking away from her :)

One of our favorite places to order lunch from for pick up.  We will go out of our way to get their sandwiches and salads.  The food is consistently tasty and the employees are always very nice.  We haven't tried anything on the menu yet that we didn't like!

Heard about The Cracked Egg from an previous Las Vegas resident. 

Our waitress, Emily, was wonderful! I asked for recommendations and she gave me a wonderful selection. I ended up choosing "Joe's Scramble" and substituting bacon instead of the ground beef. It was FANTASTIC! The scramble was a "egg"celent, cheesy, bacony and spinach monster! So delicious!

He choose the "Biscuits and Gravy" and he couldn't stop raving. The biscuits were soft and the gravy was tasty. He was able to substitute bacon instead of the hash browns and the bacon was cooked to perfection! 

Two meals and full bellies for under $30!!! I wish there were more places like this!

Our only con was the booth. The cushion was lacking so don't plop down in them like we did and hurt yourself.

Great breakfast food!  Have been to this location several times and every time I am happy with the food and the service. Was there with a party of 5 for breakfast.  Normally I order the Greek omelet, but this time I got the Tropical French toast.  It was yummy!  Others  ordered French toast, multigrain pancakes, and a skillet.  Everyone was happy with their meal.  The service was not the best but the place was crowded on a Thursday morning at 9 AM so that is understandable.

My new breakfast spot!!!  The veggie breakfast skillet is my favorite.
Lots of veggies and seasoned potatoes. I asked them to go easy on the cheese and they did it perfectly.  My hubby tried the sweet potato/apple skillet and really enjoyed it. It's always fun to try something different. 
Love this place!

ok let me be clear.... this place is absolutely amazing. Coffee cake is to die for. Tropical french toast and thats with macadamian nuts and toasted coconut is f****** good. Seasoned potatoes are way better than a long shot vs. Egg works, perfectly seasoned and not salty as f***. anyways yeah i feel like John Smith discovering the New World. this place rocks. And our server Cory is amazing!!
Get there early to avoid the wait on the weekend.  Good place to get away from the buzz on the strip.  Corned beef hash fans will not be disappointed.

I do love eggs, and this place makes egg-ceptional eggs.  They are egg-celent actually, and you can do many things while eating eggs.  You can read an egg-sistentilent novel, study for an egg-xam, or fight Dr. Eggman in Sonic the Hedgehog, or just eat breakfast with me while I make bad puns all morning.

The place is rather big and clean, so while lots of people come here there is often either little or no wait for a table or counter seat.  Wait staff was nice and attentive, almost taking my order right away when they saw I wasn't looking at my menu anymore.  Ordered coffee and a Southwest skillet.

Coffee wasn't really the best I have had, but the food was simply excellent.  That southwest skillet was absolutely delicious, and I highly recommend it to anyone craving a mexican style breakfast.  Salsa was a bit too mild though, but then again I have a perchance for liking to punish my digestive system with spicy food, so don't mind me :).  

I would definitely come back here.  It is a little pricer than eating at ihop or denny's, but it's absolutely worth it.

PROS:
Delicious, well-made eggs
Large and clean
Good wait staff.

CONS:
Coffee isn't that great

THE VERDICT:  Will keep coming here.

It was very good.. Despite the fact that we waited a looooooong time for our food to come out.. And got the it's the kitchens fault routine.. We all work in the service industry.. So we didn't by that.. Would've been nice if something was comped considering how long we waited for our food..instead of a bunch of "I'm sorry" from everyone that walked by.

Meh. I would like faster, friendlier service, better tasting food made with better ingredients. Raspberry stuffed french toast was yucky except for the real raspberries on it. When ordering coffee, be sure to check the creamer. We put in the default creamer on the table and it was sickeningly sweet French Vanilla. Asked for new coffee and plain cream. What we got was a non dairy product sweetened with corn syrup. Yuck. Finally...we asked for whole milk. Also, who opens sugar packets and puts them back into the dispenser?! No appropriate seating for our family of five. They sat us at a table for four. The place was clean and quiet toward close of day on Sunday.

Food is terrific, service is terrific the food portions are large you won't leave hungry. The servers are attentive and very pleasant. The place is clean and so are the bathrooms. I would definitely recommend this place.

Great lunch place. Very spacious with lots of booths. Located near a Starbucks. This place delivers quality food. The hamburgers are delicious and cooked perfectly. Flavorful moist tender meat. in between a hot soft bun. I also had the eggs Benedict. Nice presentation. The Hollandaise sauce was alright. It seems generic to me. It taste like it came  from  a jar. The fries and hash browns are a definite 5 star. Service was blazing fast and super friendly. I like this place :-)

I had to meet someone at this Cracked Egg location a few weeks back. I had already formed an opinion of the chain based on another Cracked Egg that I visited. HOWEVER, I was blown away at the entire experience. 

The servers are funny, personable and engaging, the food is great and the decor was perfect. I had such a positive experience that i went back several times on my own since the first visit and even had a meeting there. 

After having been there several times now, I can say that I have had the same great experience every time. The management must have a great system in place to train the servers and cooks to provide a consistent high level of customer experience. 

I just cannot say too many good things about this Cracked Egg.

Amazing. First time here.
Service: perfect, couldn't have asked for a better waitress

Food: incredible EGGS BENEDICT! Cooked to perfection and just the perfect amount of sauce! I added avocado and was the perfect combo. HASH BROWNs great..not the best I've had. Definitely getting the Benedict again!

I think this place needs to be on the dinErs , drive-ins an dives show!!! Def coming back!

My husband and I were referred to the Cracked Egg and we will forever be life long customers. The food and the service was excellent. 

So next time you're in Las Vegas stop by the Cracked Egg on Rainbow, ask for Liz tell her Jeannette & cornel sent you and order the coffee cake. I promise you will not be disappointed

The food was good...the service was great.  I will try the French Toast selection next time and see if that is good.  I felt this was just a typical breakfast place...nothing special but I will be back :)

Very nice menu selection and presentation. Every dish looks delicious. Food didn't taste fatty/oily like most breakfast places.

Multigrain pancakes were good, and I'm glad they put the whipped butter and syrup on the side so that I can monitor my consumption. The side of berries for $3 more included raspberries, blueberries, and strawberries. About 1 cup's worth.

The Mexican skillet was very delicious. I'm not normally a skillet person, but I think I just became one.

The restaurant's decor is homey with a chicken and egg theme. Cute.

Restaurant was clean. Service was friendly and accomoodating.

Coffee cake is always good. I usually order my usual, country fried chicken steak and eggs with gravy...:) Vegas doesn't have much breakfast places...this suffice the cravings....nothing fancy...more like your fancier version of denny's.
Very good breakfast/brunch spot; one of our favorites! Eggs are cooked right, hash browns rock, coffee cake is delicious!

This is one of those fast in & out type of breakfast places that serves such good food. The eggs are always done right just as you asked for them and the hash browns when ordered crispy aren't just burnt on the outside but soggy on the inside. If you're ever in the neighborhood you should stop in for breakfast, you won't regret it.

This place is a MUST!  Just came back from a long weekend in LV and we were in dyer need of something other than "strip & hotel food".  An individual in my party is also Gluten free so we GOOGLED for Gluten free options for brunch.  The Cracked Egg came up and their menu looked amazing and they did have Gluten free options.  We did see some of their reviews and decided it was worth a try.  We were staying at Luxor, the taxi ride was about $20 but, it was worth it.  We went on Sunday morning about 10:30 and the wait was minimal.  They have an extensive menu, I wanted to have a club sandwich or their grilled cheese but, had to try an omelette.  I was not disappointed, it was delicious.  Also, they have an option of toast or coffee cake with a meal and, do yourself a favor, get the coffee cake. It was warm, it had raspberry filling, it is homeade, I wish I ordered one to take home.  The service was fast and friendly.  Stay away from the buffets and give this place a try.  

*If you are coming from the strip, make sure you take down the number for your taxi so they can come back and pick you up.  Our taxi driver was the best and gave us his mobile and picked us up within 15 minutes of calling him.  This place is NOT in walking distance from the strip.

Heard about this place from my mom and sister.  Every time mom would visit sis in Vegas they would always come here.  So naturally I just had to try it out for myself.  

The place has a "mom and pop" feel to it and is very welcoming.  I love a breakfast that tastes and feels like mom cooked it.  The Cracked Egg delivered that momma cooked feel perfectly.  I order the classic French toast, scrambled eggs, and bacon.  Pretty simple you might say, but this is where other breakfast places come up short.  Others might be able to wow you with exotic breakfast options(which The Cracked Egg also has), but they lose track of the easy stuff.  Not The Cracked Egg!  Eggs were perfect, bacon amazing, and the French toast to die for!  I'm pretty sure the girlfriend and sister loved their dishes too, but I was so wrapped up with enjoying mine I didn't pay attention to them. =)  I could go on for hours on why the food was so good, instead I will just say you gotta come have breakfast if you are in the area.

Plan on making The Cracked Egg a "go-to" for breakfast every time I come to visit my sister!

There are 2 requirements for the perfect brunch place: comforting food and warm service. The Cracked Egg nails the service. The servers and front of house staff are so friendly. It's like being around family. I could rave about the staff.

As for the food, it's good, just not great. I've tried two dishes here. They're solid, but I wish that there was just a bit more flavor. 

The prices are decent, and I would come back. Maybe, I just haven't found the best dish yet.

We've been going here for a long time. My wife and I spot once or twice a week after we drop our daughters off to school. Breakfast date... We would bring our daughters when they don't have school. Great place food is good and staff are awesome. But recently they hired a new hostess. Short girl with black hair. We are regulars and she obviously didn't know that but she was very rude to us. Especially to my wife. So unprofessional, her attitude sucked. This was on 6/9/17. We would go every Fridays but today 6/16/17 we didn't go. We called to talk to manager that day. We don't like complaining but they need to know what kine of people they hire. Hopefully she changes her attitude. For now they lost our business. We were just treated terribly in front of our daughters. Sad...

This place is a great breakfast spot.  I have yet to venture into their lunch menu.  I'm enjoying the coffee cake that comes with breakfast.  So far it has been a different one on every visit.  My breakfast is usually simple, egg whites and some bacon.  The hash-brown is also great, it is never over cooked.   Service is outstanding and it's in a great location with lots of parking.

I ordered the croissant French toast with berries and bananas. Sounds good, right? Well you know that smell when you walk into Petsmart or Petco? That's what my French toast tasted like :( I was so bummed.. I ate about half till I couldn't take it anymore. It barely had the flavor of French toast, it was more like a croissant pressed down on the griddle with a little butter, with an added Petsmart flavor, lol. I don't know what it was. I finished off the berries, bananas, and my side of eggs. My son ordered a basic eggs, sausage, and pancakes.. which you can't go wrong with that! The pancakes were yummy and the eggs were cooked perfectly. Our waitress, Traci, was vibrant and cheerful. My son loved her! She was awesome. I just wished my French toast tasted like French toast.

My friend and I wanted to try this place out. She's lives in Vegas but doesn't usually eat breakfast until I came to visit. She had the corned beef hash which is not what you'd expect. It's thinly slice strips of corned beef cooked with onions and bell peppers. She was expecting the more mushy type but she still enjoyed this one. I ordered the eggs benedict which was really good. The hollandaise sauce was delicious! The coffee cake itself was so soft of fluffy. mmmm I'd like to come back to try some of their other breakfast dishes. Gotta wait till October to come back to Vegas though. Oh well, this will be worth the wait.

Amazing place to eat! We were a group of 13 and with that much people your bound to wait awhile to be seated. That was the only problem we had was waiting to be seated. But after awhile the lady noticed we were getting restless so she sat us down in 2 separate tables but right next to each other which worked out great. Everything we had was brought out quick and super delicious! I had the country fried steak which was cooked to perfection and my boyfriend had the monte cristo which was also amazing! Our waitress was even kind enough to split the bill for us.

I'd give it 6 stars.  Came for a 3 day visit and we had to come back twice.  Everything was top notch - food, service, decor.  It has a homey feel but it's also very clean and bright.  Thanks for offering gluten free pancakes.

So today is June 30th. My girlfriend and I decided to get breakfast after adventuring downtown and going to donut bar.

Unfortunately today I'm going to have to say this review should be a 1 star.

My girlfriend had initially ordered the chicken fried steak. But once we got it, she said it was all soggy. I poked my fork into it, and I didn't even hear the slightest crunch. On top of that, the gravy is a bit too thick, and the flavor just simply overpowered the taste of the steak.

Since that wasn't the best, she decided to grab the bacon cheeseburger skillet with no bacon.

It's so overloaded with cheese, that it looked unappetizing and unappealing!
Basically looks like a hamburger helper with potatoes instead of macaroni!

I'm sorry to say this, but how do you mess up coffee? Like wtf how do you fuck can you mess up coffee?!

But on the plus side you guys get an extra star today because the potatoes tasted pretty good!

Service wasn't all that great.

I ordered chicken tenders, then as the waitress repeated the order back to me, she said chicken tenders, but in the end when the food came out, she brought out a chicken fried steak.
If you have a piece of paper with the initial order, how are you going to bring out a different one?! 

I completely lost my appetite as soon as my actual order came out. As I said earlier, the gravy's taste ruined whole dish.

We're gonna go home and recook everything we just ordered today.

Completely ruined our day.

Pretty cool joint for b-fast I guess.  not a good hangover spot-too loud.  

Yummy everything though.  Eggs bennie, waffles, some crazy contraption called the cracked egg croissant which is so right.

minus 1 star for the noise, another for no mimosas.

I should take another one off for the totally spaced out gang of hostesses working at the front who coudnt understand the meaning of "in a hurry" to save their life.

I will let it slide.

Mom and I stopped in here for a brunch type number.  Of course, at a place called The Cracked Egg you're inspired to choose from the breakfast menu.  I had two eggs over medium, dry wheat toast and hash browns with coffee and she had two scrambled eggs with sliced tomatoes and coffee cake.  The service is fast, sweet and never let your mugs go thirsty.  They serve the coffee cake hot which is an awesome touch.  Everything was good, nothing in the great category.  Mom and I both thought the coffee cake, while moist and soft  to the extreme, was a sugar overload for us and she rued the decision to order toast.  So all in all, 3 to 3.5 stars.  

P.S.  If I were in the throes of a hangover this place is not quite greasy enough, which is a great thing since I wasn't drunk.  :)

I'm a fan of brunch places and I've added this one to my list. I went for the western omelet and was thoroughly satisfied. They also give you a choice of toast or coffee cake. Umm coffee cake please! This is a good place to stop and load up your last morning in Vegas before the looooong drive back home.
My favorite breakfast spot!  Service and food are great! Portions are large.  The coffee cake --- warm and worth coming back again and again for!

I love monte cristo sandwiches and I am very critical of the dipping sauce. That being said syrup is never an option for a true monte cristo... and it should have not then on thin slice of ham and turkey... in a word "disappointing" But the service was great
Good service excellent food!  The seasoned potatoes and hash browns are awesome. Crisp and not oily. We liked the scrambled eggs, enchilada omelette, and the coffee cake.
It's breakfast, not much can necessarily go wrong. Greet, water, coffee, digs (omelet, huevos rancheros and fruit plate). Good conversation. Ample parking and kind service.

My family and I go to breakfast every Sunday this Sunday we decided to try the cracked egg on rainbow and sunset very big mistake we all order drinks everything came but they forgot a coffee no big deal the waiter said he will be right back with a Nother cup 20 minutes later I had to go track him down to say hey we are still waiting on the coffee To top it off the food came out wrong when I asked for a manager the guy  walked out from the kitchen I told him I don't want anything for free I just want to bring this to your attention and began to explain he looked at me as if I was stupid said sorry and walked away like that's crazy first and last time we ever go there

Service: super super fast.
Coffee: tasted like water.
Coffee cake: delicious.
El vaquero omelette: not flavor at all.
Pancakes, yummy
Bacon, jam, sausage omelette: super yummy 
Seasoned potatoes: dry as hell.

My favorite go-to breakfast spot in Las Vegas.  Yes there's higher quality joints but I would go to The Cracked Egg over any breakfast chain. It's really egg-celent!  

Favorites: Northshore scramble, Chorizo Skillet, Eggs Benny's.  
Awesome: Complimentary Coffee Cake.  BEST COFFEE CAKE....EVER!
TIP: If there's 2 of you, skip the wait and sit at the counter/bar.

The service staff is warm and friendly. My water is never empty.  The place has modest breakfast themed deco on the walls.  The wait for a seat on a weekend can take a while (sometimes up to 30min, no one likes to wait for breakfast) but we are always OK with sitting at the counter where there's usually a spot open and you get to see the action of the servers behind the counter.

The quality of the food is eggs-emplary! Everything taste fresh, including the fresh fruit if it comes with your dish.  The coffee cake is delicious (different flavors every week, my fav is the ones with fruit).  The eggs are rarely over done or underdone (I order over easy on my skillets).  The potatoes are crispy and hot. The coffee is standard but I'll let that slide cause this place isn't called "The cracked bean".

Overall, Cracked egg is an eggs-traordinary breakfast spot! Good eats and good meets. Try it today! YAY!

Have been going to this place for many years. The coffee cake is what gets us to go - though it's changed over the years, it still doesn't disappoint (especially when it comes out warm). All of the other dishes are done well and everyone is usually really friendly. Cozy (and not cheap) atmosphere so great to bring family and kids.

I personally think this is an ok place. I would actually rather have IHOP over the Cracked Egg. My fiance and I ordered Steak and Eggs, as our no carb breakfast.. It was not done correctly, but they took so long to even cook it that i didnt want to change it. I had to eat this tough piece of meat and I couldnt even finish it because my gums started hurting.

I have been here a few times before, so I want to give them the benefit of the doubt. Our server was really nice, and it wasnt her fault that the cooks didnt cook it correctly. And the previous times I have been here, I choose something simple like oatmeal and stuff. 

There are better breakfast places around I say.

First off, let me just say I LOVE a place that still puts a Monte Cristo sandwich on the menu, even if I did make a New Year's resolution about fried foods.  I like old school friendly coffee shops and this has that charm.  Sadly, that's where it ended for us.

My Monte Cristo (did you think I wouldn't order it?), while tasty inside, was overdone and dark brown, not golden, just this side of burnt. It wasn't very big, nor loaded with meat, which is weird for a Monte Cristo since the whole idea of a triple layer ham, swiss and turkey sandwich dipped in french toast batter, fried and coated in powdered sugar is to be colossal and leave you stuffed.  The bread was standard grocery store loaf size.  It was offered with potatoes or hash browns, but I ordered fruit, which was melon and not very good.  End of story for me.

Hub had the House Original sandwich; roast beef and cream cheese with red onion , tomato and lettuce.  He asked for no tomato, and also sadly ordered fruit.

The sandwich was a shocker, with no more than a 1/4 lb of meat and cream cheese spread thin.  It also had tomato on it...oops. The beef was not freshly sliced.  The bread was again nothing special, average size and not extremely fresh.  For a signature sandwich, it was a big disappointment to my better half.  We were both still hungry when we left.

The service was very nice, quick, and pleasant, though I don't particularly like being called 'dear' by someone maybe 10 to 15 years younger than me.  I'm not a blue hair!

I wish I give The Cracked Egg a terrible review so I can keep it all to myself.  But it is my favorite breakfast/lunch place in Vegas.

The decor is sort of country chic, with booths and tables.  You can sit outside, inside or at the bar.  On weekends, at peak times, there is often a wait to get a table, so plan accordingly!  To me, it's worth the wait.

The food is awesome.  My "go to" lunch is "The Club" sandwich, piled so high with meats, cheese, tomatoes, avocados and lettuce that it actually needs the long toothpick to hold it together.  And the avocados are actually ripe and tasty.  As a Californian, that's super important to me.  (There's not much worse than an unripe avocado!)  I usually eat half and take the rest home.  I've had both fruit as a side, as well as potato salad.  I loved the potato salad, which is homemade, using red potatoes.

I crave their blueberry pancakes.  They're pretty simple.  Blueberry pancakes.  Short stack is three large pancakes.  But they use fresh blueberries.  So it's perfect.  It goes great with their fresh-squeezed orange juice.

I've also had their Denver omelette.  Cooked perfectly, with a nice layer of cheese on top.  Seasoned potatoes are awesome.  If you opt for hash browns, they are crispy and perfectly cooked.

Service was attentive.  The waitress checked every few minutes to see if we needed anything.  Bathrooms are very clean.

All in all, I love this place.  It's not fancy.  But if you want a solid breakfast/lunch spot with lots of options, this is a good one.

We decided to take the day off from the strip and go to Red Rock Canyon. On the way we found this great little gem. The food was amazing and the portions are HUGE. I had a build your own skillet and was in heaven with my choice and the sourdough toast was to die for! SO glad we found this!

They get points for having a gluten free menu and being very nice. And maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but I was just not impressed with the cooking skills. I got a skillet breakfast, which is a choose-what-you-want sort of thing. I got scrambled eggs, broccoli, spinach, onions and mushrooms, with extra crispy hash browns. So what I got was cooked hash browns (my friend's were JUST barely cooked, not crispy at all) underneath steamed veg and then my scrambled eggs. Not integrated at all, and barely cooked, zero flavor. The onions were basically raw. No salt, no butter, no flavor. But healthy! My friend got the biscuits and gravy benedict which he liked. It was small and OK. I would try it again and get something different. Very nice staff and a great patio.

Great place for breakfast.  I had heard so much hype about this place, I guess maybe I was expecting a little bit more.  But, I definitely was not disappointed.  Food is fresh, service is outstanding, and portions are huge.  They had lemon coffee cake the day i was there, and it was definitely worth getting instead of the toast.

I'm sure I'll be back there again.

The green chile huevos rancheros is the best breakfast dish I've had in ages. Perfectly cooked and seasoned pork in a yummy sauce. The seasoned fried potatoes were also cooked perfectly and were not greasy at all. When the food is combined with a very attentive waitress, it equals a win!
Great Food. Great Portions! Good service. It was a little packed so parking was a pain. No complaints otherwise

Always a great experience with the fam when we come here.  The service is always quick and friendly, and we love their coffee cake!  The prices are reasonable and the menu items are never disappointing.

Being new to town I took the advice of a local and tried this place out for breakfast. My order was correct and brought to me quickly. This was true for both days that I ate here while in town. Just a little mom-and-pop joint, no Wi-Fi, no loud TVs, just a good family atmosphere.

Best standard American breakfast spot in las vegas. Egg white north shore scramble is my go to. Burgers and stuff are good too. Coffee cake is the star of the show! And u always run into Randy Couture at the counter!
Love, love, love this place. Have not met a bad dish yet. Took my family for breakfast and they loved it. Wish we had one in Cali. We will be back soon.

Great place to grab breakfast.  I had come here with some friends as this is one of their go-to breakfast places in Vegas.  The portions are decent sized and filling.  I ordered the Veggie Benny (vegetarian eggs benedict) and it was good.  The place was pretty busy, so it seems to be a popular spot.  The prices are also reasonable.  Would definitely return.

Very consistently good breakfast. We usually hit up Cracked Egg the Sunday morning after a Sin City Rollergirls bout when I'm sore, stiff, dehydrated (not sure if it was from the bout or after party), and may or may not have have showered yet. Cracked Egg Veggie Omelet, seasoned potatoes, and sourdough toast are usually just what the doc ordered.

There's usually a bit of a wait but I don't think we've had to wait any longer than 10 minutes.  The waitresses are always friendly and I don't think they've ever made a mistake on our order. 

The food isn't "OMG SO GOOD" but it's always tasty. The broccoli in my veggie omelet is always nice and great. Love the seasoned potatoes. 

There's usually excellent people watching and clearly some folks who never actually made it home the night before.

Our Food was great and our Waitress was awesome!! She was very nice , prompt and pleasant the entire time !

They were very busy which was expected because it was a Sunday and we were told the wait was about 20 minutes or so. After waiting close to an hour our we noticed people that came in after us were getting seated already and we went up and asked how much longer and why others were being seated before us ? The hostess literally went ugh , we called your name at 12 o'clock and the funny thing is that it was literally 12 o'clock on the dot at that moment . When looking down we had noticed that about 6 other groups after us had already been seated. Not a huge deal other than the Hostess's horrible attitude and to top it off started arguing with us for no reason ! 

The good news was the other hostess stepped right in and took us to a table . We have been to the Cracked Egg on Green Valley at least 5 times or so and this was our first time to this location . We will go back . 

Just a note is that some people create there own issues instead of just saying sorry and taking care of the customer. That's all people really want is to be helped and treated with Care !

I've gone to every location and they are equally as great. I love the food and the service! Any time I have family in town, this is where I take them! I love the stuffed French toast and their eggs benedict. I can never decide which one to get so I always get the stuffed French toast with half an order of eggs benedict.
They always have great customer service and their coffee cake is to die for. It's so moist and different I can't explain it, just delicious.

Amazing homemade food! Best place to come in for breakfast in Vegas!! You will be back for more, I know I will!! Friendly staff and great way to start your day. Highly recommend! Thank you for the great food :))) happy customer

I like this place for late breakfasts in Las Vegas but they are just open until 2pm.
I ordered Joe's scrambled and it was awesome.
Service lady wad very nice. I'll come back.

Terrible service. I called well in advance to ask if I could bring my dog and I was told yes! Then the bitch ass old white lady basically yelled at us to tell us no dogs. WHILE I HAVE MY REGISTERED EMOTIONAL SUPPORT ANIMAL!!
Friendly staff ; prompt and excellent service. Great twists on some breakfast staples.  Try the Corn Beef Hash. Hash brown game is on point

The Cracked Egg is does NOT honor Veterans and does NOT celebrate Veterans Day. Brought my WWII dad here for breakfast on Veterans Day. He was disappointed as was I. Unfortunately never again. Food is ok.

Edited to add: I emailed the owners to say I was really surprised that they chose not to celebrate our  country's heroes and they never responded or even acknowledged the issue. Poor form. Definite fail.
Hands down top two fav breakfast place in LAS VEGAS.. "Lighten up" is my favorite go to healthy breakfast plate. Everything is good:))) Service is always warm and welcoming..
The food here was light and tasty. It was notably better than Egg Works.
Excellent coffee cake, like to die for!! Tortilla soup was a major hit! Great experience for first day in Vegas!

I've been coming here for years. The customer service is consistent and their coffee cake is to die for. I always get a piece. Plus their decor is really nice and homey which is a plus for me. Expect a little wait on the weekends because they're usually busy but I've never waited more that 15-20 minutes.

Love this place!

Stopped in for breakfast after a big night out. This is the perfect hangover spot.

Service is good, fast.

I ordered a Big Bad Wolfe omelette and got the home fries. Instead of toast opt for the Coffee Cake because it's warm, and freaking delicious. 

Glad I live in the area because this is going to be a regular spot for me. Lots of breakfast and lunch options.

Don't miss it!

I don't typically write reviews (ever) but I must say the Cracked Egg made an irretrievable impression. Not being from the area and staying at place a little far from Vegas (good ol Henderson) led me to this spot. Immediate attention and greets as soon as I walked in through the door. For a Saturday morning this place wasn't all that busy and we were seated within a few seconds LITERALLY seconds of walking in. The staff were all really polite, friendly and seemed to genuinely care about our experience.

Now let's talk about the food. From their Chili and cheese omelette, pumpkin white chocolate coffee cake to their chimichangas! (I didn't actually order all this food, picked off my bfs plate ;)) It was all great! Delicious. I almost wanted to try another savory cake to go. (Watching the carbs) And on our way out a huge basket filled with complimentary chocolate mints! Definitely recommend if you're in the area or don't want to pay an arm and a leg for a breakfast in Vegas which isn't allll that far. :)
Awesome place! Just what the Doc ordered after a full night on the strip with 3 hours of sleep! Great food and friendly staff!

I can't believe after living 2 exits away for a year and half we only just tried this gem this weekend?! My husband and I have tried so many breakfast spots in LV and this one lives up to what others have told me about it. Decently priced food, you can add on 1 or 2 pancakes rather than a full order (glad someone caught on) and food service was quick (which my husband likes). I got the northern scramble (I think was the name) and my hubs got the carnitas one, 2 coffees, and pancakes all under $35. Good deal. We'll be back!

Great breakfast place, remember there is only so much that you can do with eggs, toast, and bacon but what can be done is done well at the Cracked Egg!!

The place is always busy but they get everybody in and out pretty fast without anybody feeling rushed, matter of fact, I was really impressed with how many of the servers took to to stop and talk with the regulars that they knew.

The Sin City Skillets are all very tasty and very filling, the French Toast is very fresh and sweet, and the Hash Browns (which is a breakfast staple for me) were perfect.

The menu is large, there is something for everybody and when you are at the Cracked Egg you just kinda feel at home.

Until next time Yelpers ........................ Be Local, Live Local, and whenever you can, Buy Local!!!!!!
This is by far my favorite breakfast spot. The food is always good no matter what I order. The coffee cake and coffee is on point!

I got the country beni - basically a cross between eggs benedict and biscuits and gravy.  What a great idea!  I thought the poached eggs were done just perfect, the sausage had a nice spice to it, and the gravy was just right - not too salty.  the only complaint I have is that the biscuit was a bit chewy, it could have been more crumbly...maybe just over mixed.

I would totally go here again!!

We went here a few days ago for lunch. The food was very good. I got coffee, grapefruit juice, and a turkey wrap with potatoes on the side. I ate every bite. My mom was not impressed. She said the food was too expensive and not good enough for the price. The outside of the restaurant makes you think you should dress super nice to eat there, but when you walk in, it kinda reminded me of a little deli. It had simple booths, not so many decorations, and it just wasn't fancy. Simple, but good. I will go back again for the food.
Absolutely yummy!! They make the best red velvet coffee cake!! Also the house potatoes were so crunchy and flavored perfect. Friendly staff and cool atmosphere!!

Having lunch with my boyfriend here for the first time and Cory our waitress, gave us great customer service. We received our food very quickly and it turned out delicious. I definitely recommend this place to friends and family.  :)

Where do i begin. This used to be, bar none my favorite breakfast place in town, living a couple of miles away i have eaten here over a hundred times between 2006 and 2010 but then two things happened for me 1) the prices got ridiculously high while the portions got smaller and 2) the quality of the food has changed or they started using inferior ingrediants because i get nauseous about a half hour after eating there each time now which is highly unusual for me. This has been the case several times, like four, so i give up and drive up to trop n jones for some awesome breakfast at the black bear.

VERONICA was an outstanding waitress, attentive and engaging. 
She clarified my order actually helping me pick something better and more to my preference.
Sit in her section she will take great care of you!
Food ok , not very flavorful. my husband likes this place I am in search of a better place. Was served a BLT style sandwich, the bacon wasn't freshly cooked, guacamole bland, turkey couldn't even taste it, criossant soggy, way too much lettuce excessive amount seriously could have made a side salad out of it. Seasoned shoe strings fries outstanding, I never have liked shoestring fries, so this was a delightful first.
Biscuits and gravy lacking flavor.
I prefer Cracker Barrel.

There are lots of great brunch places in Vegas, and this is one of the best. The specials are always tasty and generously portioned, and I really enjoy the breakfast skillet with sweet potatoes and hash browns. Some of the daily coffee cakes are delicious, and some are just okay, but I love that it's a different flavor every time I come in. The clam chowder isn't my favorite. Service at the counter is always fast, friendly, and accurate, even when it's busy.
I have been coming here for 15 years. Best breakfast food in Las Vegas. I'm a local and wouldn't go anywhere else. Friendly staff and the waitresses always remember what I order.
Fabulous gluten free items. The best breakfast place in town and its local. The service is quick best poached eggs!!
Good breakfast spot for when you're leaving  Vegas. I had the eggs Benedict. It was amazing. Be sure to try the coffee cake.
Been here a few times and the breakfast is great as usual. Breakfast is a pretty simple meal but they do it right! I make the effort to get off the strip and head here every time I'm in town.

Horrible service, I ordered the Californian omelette.  What I got was a flat over cooked thing with two whole pieces of bacon shoved in the middle and a lump of avocado on top that looked like a tumor.  I was shocked, I said I had expected something where the bacon and avocado was chopped up and put inside the omelette, so they took it back.  I swear they didn't even make a fresh one they just chopped up the old returned one and threw more cheese on it.  We asked to speak to the manager, I don't even think they sent him over.  Dude couldn't give two shits about the fact neither thing served was an omelet.  

Never going back again, they are rude, and don't give a crap about giving good properly presented food.
This is a great spot to get breakfast or lunch the flavors are great the service is great. Must truths coffee cake

Loved having breakfast here! Very good food! The only drawback is that their plates, cups and silverware are way old and worn out. I think they need a makeover of their "china". Other than that the service is great and food is good. Just like every other decent breakfast spot.

Great place, great food! Our server was very nice and attentive! The place is very cute, not one of us was disappointed with our meal, there were 8 of us in Father's Day! It was very reasonably priced and I will definitely keep this place in the back of my head for when I'm in town. I definitely recommend the breakfast sandwich croissant. We got our food in a very timely manner, and everything was great.
The only bad part was they weren't terribly busy, two 8 tops completely open and the manager I think, maybe she was the hostess tried to offer us two booths after a 39 minute wait, we opted out and then she made it seem like she was doing us a favor by giving us one of the 8 tops. I kind of understood, because what if they had reservations but through our entire meal, the other one never became occupied. So no deal breakers for complaints! Definitely recommend this spot!

I am a montecristo sandwich connoisseur, and this place has definitely one of the best I've ever tasted.  All the other food was certainly passable breakfast fare.  The coffeecake was the lightest textured coffeecake I'd ever encountered.  Four stars for the montecristo, three for the food in general.

I am usually not a breakfast person but after reading the Yelp reviews I decided to give this place a shot.  I walked in at 10:30am on a Thursday.  There were lots of empty tables and it was not packed at all.  I was seated right away in a nice booth by the window.  Cory was a delightful and on the ball type of server.  I ordered Coffee, Bottled Water, and The North Shore with seasoned potatoes.  
Seasoned Potatoes 5/5. 
The North Shore was good but had a little to much cheese 4/5.  
Coffee 4/5 
Service 5/5
I would return but I will wait for warmer weather so I can sit outside.

Love this place!!! Always great food and friendly staff!! Can't go wrong w any food here!! Breakfast or lunch any time. I love getting the club sandwich- always stacked high with a huge amount of fresh avocados!!  The seasoned potatoes and coffee cake  are in house made and to die for!!

Always noticed this driving and visiting Archie's for lunch (in the same complex). I asked the server if this place was related to "Egg Works" / "Egg and I"? She replied "the owner here used to be a part owner of Egg and I.." Similarities in the menu were obvious.. " Well, I'm a fan of Egg and I, so I guess this place should be good too?! 

Coffee Cake: Fresh, Spongy Soft, a little sweet/cinnamony.. Delicious! Reminded me of the 'Heavenly' Banana Nut muffin at Egg and I..

Homemade Corned Beef Hash: Real corned beef, short slices mixed with diced onions and bell peppers.. Eggs on top (I opted for egg whites this time). I went with their hashbrowns, it came on a separate dish (decent size). The Corned Beef was good, better than the usual canned versions. Hash Browns were average.

Chicken Fried Steak, Gravy and Eggs: Nicely portioned, chicken and gravy was good, eggs scrambled, seasoned potatoes (identical to seasoned potatoes at Egg and I) came as little fried treats with heavy seasoning and the white toast just like at every other restaurant.

Service, Atmosphere, Value and Taste: Overall, just squeezed into the 4 star level, in my opinion (the coffee cake gave them the edge). I plan to try more of their offerings.. If you like Egg and I, then you should feel the same for this place.. Or if your a breakfast person, it should satisfy!

I love breakfast and this place is a fam fav.  we love to come here on a sunday to start our day with a light yummy brunch.

i'm giving it 3 stars because the girls who are behind the counter NEVER look friendly.  they are the welcome you see when you walk in... sometimes the looks on their faces are uncomfortable.. it's weird.

don't expect a smile when U come in.  it's really rare they look happy.. but think it's life issues they wear on their face.. so i don't take it personal. neither should you.

the plus:  THE FOOD! and the waitresses on the other hand are really friendly and helpful with ordering tips.  food comes quick and the portions are perfect for the price.  

there's a lot of omelets to choose from.. my favs are the south and
north shore.  daughter and I love the stuffed p b and j French toast.. tah-die!

Came here with my wife and friends. There is nothing to complain about, I came here twice within the span of about 2 weeks. The first time I got country fried chicken with hash browns and toast. With a side of their coffee cake which is absolutely delish. My entire meal was tasty, everyone liked their breakfast they ordered.

The second time I got eggs Benedict, I didn't like it as much, but was still good. Overall, don't pass on the coffee cake. Very solid option for breakfast.

This place keeps getting more and more popular and there is usually always a wait. Not saying this is a bad thing, but when your hungry and or hungover... I want/need food!! Their Benedict ole is the bomb... That bernaise sauce is like candy in my mouth. Also, their coffee cake is heaven in my mouth too!!

The only downfall is they don't serve bloody Mary's... If they did it would complete my great breakfast experiences! I'm not going to lie.... I something choose egg works for breakfast, because I can get my weekend Bloody Mary fix.
One of my favorite breakfast places. I love the French toast & the eggs Benedict. I always leave satisfied!

I was excited about a little local restaurant off of the the strip. unfortunately the food was average at best the server was not friendly and screwed up the order not once not twice but three times and it was overpriced

This place was pretty packed when I visited, but it was during breakfast on the weekend, so I guess it was my fault for choosing a popular time to go! There were plenty of gluten free options available, which I was very appreciative of. The waitress was attentive and super friendly, the food came out quickly, and overall the taste was delicious and the cost was pretty low. It's a great location right off the 215 and just a bit further north of the Arroyo shopping center - a great place to stop for a quick bite in the middle of running errands!

My husband and i come here alot for breakfast and if we have visitors from out of town and they wanna have breakfast.. this is the place to bring them.'Eggs Benedict never let down. I always order them with the season potatoes. Their coffee cake is so good too and fresh! the service is really good and quick. hey always try to accommodate you. I also like the salads.. It's big and plentiful! Definitely an awesome place for breakfast and lunch!

LOVE The Cracked Egg!

This is probably one of my most favorite restaurants...in the WORLD. There is a location super close to my parent's house at home, and the though of going here is comforting and exciting (wow that's not at all cheesy). I often go with one of my best friends Ame, which probably adds to why I love this place so much. 

Everything here is delicious. My friend Ame has ordered the Garden Patch omelette and enjoyed it quite a bit. My cousin and brother have gotten the scrambles and the sandwiches over the years, and I never hear a complaint from them. I almost always get one of Breanne's Basics, which all come with home fries/hash browns and either toast or coffee cake. 

Speaking of coffee cake - HOLY SMOKES IT IS AMAZING. It is cinnamony, fluffy, usually a generous serving, and is served warm. You MUST get it. Even though I usually get one of the Basics meals, this cake kinda makes it extra awesome. Even if you get a sandwich, order the coffee cake. DO IT!

Service is always wonderful, and the place is always clean. I've been here more times than I can count on my hands combined and have always had five star service.

Food was amazing. My girlfriend had the breakfast burrito and it was the best breakfast burrito I've ever had. They season their potatoes amazingly. I had the croissant French toast and it was delicious! Service was prompt and friendly. Will definitely be coming back!

This has got to be our absolute favorite restaurant for brunch. They even offer a complete Gluten Free menu! Absolutely delicious food. We love the patio seating! Service is always on point. Coffee cake is to die for. Choose this little spot you won't be disappointed. We are absolute fans!

This has to be my second brunch place, just behind Bea Bea's in Burbank. However, this would make it my favorite brunch place in Vegas! 

I was on a gal pals weekender trip to Vegas and we choose The Cracked Egg to end our two days of gorging (which is what gal pals do: get fat together and chat about life and getting fat). 

We lucked out as we were seated right away. The service was prompt and attentive. Our server took our drink order within a minute of us being seated and seemed to return with beverages almost instantly after. 

The menu is just stocked but not too stocked (i.e. Jerry's Famous Deli). It seemed like everything was really well planned and that they only put real bangers on their list of offerings. 

We asked for recommendations and were informed that all of the boxed items were considered the more popular and highly demanded items so we paid those extra attention, but our server also shared some of her favorites. A staffer with favorites that aren't boxed tells me the food's awesome either way so I was excited. 

We all decided to pick an item and then eat our meal family style. What we selected were:

- Chocolate chip banana pancakes: I usually see banana pancakes OR chocolate chip pancakes so seeing both in one on a menu made it an automatic selection. They were everything I wanted and more. The dish came with three pancakes, all ozzing with melty chips and sweetened by bananas that were juuuust about caramelized, but still fresh tasting. They were so good I didn't need butter or syrup, but I still smeared butter, because I can't deny my inner fatty. 

- Chicken tenders, gravy, and eggs
How have I not had this before? The chicken tenders were great on their own, but with The Cracked Egg's gravy, hashbrowns, and over medium eggs, we were swooning. (only critique is that I prefer my hashbrowns a little browner)

- Corned beef hash
Really good. I consider it a cleaner version than the usual greasy and chunky standard, but I enjoyed it. 

- Veggie Benedict
It seemed plain with just avocado and tomato but, man, was it tasty. The tomato was lightly cooked so it oozed flavor and was delicious combined with the avocado, hollandaise, and yolk from the poached egg. 

- Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Coffee Cake
You mean this was FREE? We got two pieces since two of our dishes (the corned beef and tenders) came with an option of biscuit or coffee cake. This was ABSOFRIKKINLUTELY a surprise. This took your usual coffee cake, grabbed it by throat, and kicked it in its genitalia. 

Oh and the prices were really fair for brunch (cuz, yaknow, LA brunch like to act like it deserves dinner prices). 

By the time we left, the place was swamped, but the staff was very visibly keeping everything moving so I don't think anyone waited too long. 

This was the perfect spot to end our weekend and I hope I'm back in Vegas soon to hit up those tenders!

On the journey across America, our first stop was Sin City. My cousin recommended me this breakfast spot called, The Cracked Egg, which was only a few minutes away from the strip. The Cracked Egg on Rainbow Boulevard was located in a strip mall which was pretty empty for a Saturday afternoon. I guess that's what happens when it was over a hundred degrees out. This restaraunt closes at 3:00 P.M, which gave me the impression that their menu must be way above average to be able to serve only breakfast and have multiple locations.

Me and my friend reached the restaurant first so we grabbed a table for us and our three friends that were going to meet us there. Our waitress was very kind and told us it was no problem to wait in our booth while we wait for our friends. She even brought out five waters for us while she waited for our group to get together. The menu had a large variety of breakfast foods. They had the typical breakfast foods of eggs, sausages, omelettes, skillets, burgers, and other things.

I ordered the Homemade Corned Beef Hash, which was made of bell peppers, onions, and eggs. I chose to have hash browns and coffee cake on the side instead of seasoned potatoes and toast. The coffee cake arrived first and I was delighted to see that it was hot, instead of the usual cold pastries many breakfast places serve. Shortly after I finished my coffee cake, the table's main dishes came out. The Homemade Corned Beef Hash came out in a glass skillet styled dish.           It didn't resemble the typical corned beef hash found in cans, but it looked more like ham, bell peppers, and onions put underneath two scrambled eggs. My hash browns were served on a separate plate.

I was very impressed with the quality of ingredients used to make such a simple meal. The eggs were fresh, and the cooking of the hash browns were perfect. None of the potatoes were burnt, unlike many other breakfast style restaurants. The Cracked Egg is probably one of the best breakfast spots I have been to. Their quality of food and service is probably why they can afford to open their restaurants until only 3:00 P.M! I will definitely come again next time I'm in Vegas for my breakfast fix!

This place is such an awesome breakfast stop ! The service was great and I love the atmosphere of this place it's so relaxed and laid back . We got our food quick and it was delicious my little one loved his French toast and ate all of his food. Love this spot !

Tried this place out one day after a good workout. I tried out the veggie benedict which was delicious! I got the seasoned potatoes on the side and it went well with the whole meal. The benny was cooked perfectly and the tomatoes and spinach weren't super soggy like you might expect. It was also topped with a bunch of avocado which was a plus because I feel like when you go to breakfast restaurants and order anything with avocado they skimp the amount. It was topped with delicious hollandaise but they might have put a bit too much on mine but that is only a very minor complaint. They were offering freshly made mocha coffee cake and also an oreo flavor which looked like I had to have it but I skipped on it since I just had s good workout. It was a sad decision because it looked so damn good lol.

Usually a wait. Food is so so. Expensive for what you get. Slow service. Egg works down the street is a better choice. Very similar menu but more home cooked taste especially the breakfast potatoes. Not recommended.

I've been here before and it's been the same experience, fast service, good food and nice portions. Nothing extraordinary, but good.  The one complaint this time is that I ordered the corn beef hash breakfast and was disappointed that it had very little corn beef in it, like 25% beef and 75% potato. My suggestion, skip the corn beef hash breakfast.

This is my favorite lunch/breakfast spot to eat at when we are in town. I end up getting the same Kayla's Salad. The salad has diced apples, walnuts, golden raisins and blue cheese crumbles. I highly recommend a half salad because the whole one will feed 3 people easily. 

They have several options for breakfast and lunch. Service is excellent and most of them have been there for at least 4 plus years. 

Go early the place gets packed fast once the doors open up!

Overall this was a great place really enjoyed the breakfast.  It is a little far to drive early in the morning, but sometimes it is worth it when you are hungry.

Good variety as well - plenty to choose from.

The decor in this place was super cute. We came to the relization that coffee shops have the best customer service. Our waitress was excellent. It was a very homely enviornment. Yes, the coffee cake is a must. The day we went, we had the pumpkin pecan coffee cake, and it was a great start to our meal. I got the Country Benny with Hash Browns. It was really good! I would definitely get this again with extra gravy!! My boyfriend got the California Omlete with Potatoes. It was also pretty good. My only complaint about this place was how much they charged for the side sauce. A side of salsa and a side of sour cream were both $1+ each. I think $.50 - $.75 is more reasonable. It's a ways from the strip, but a great place to eat before heading back home to California. We will definitely be back!

Pretty good but nothing special. Definitely better than IHOP or Denny's, though. Have a few interesting omelettes and scrambles but nothign to really write home about. Would go again if I'm in the area and looking for breakfast but not making a special trip.

This is my favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas. The coffee cake is the best I've ever had! Beware: it has apples at the bottom, like an apple pie filling, which my husband prefers not to have. He will eat all of the fluffy cake parts though while I try to stab his hand with my fork. It's MINE!

Service is fast and friendly. My favorite breakfast meal is chicken fried steak and eggs, which is perfect here. My husband likes plain season potatoes without onions chopped into it...and that's what they serve here!
