I've never had to wait for a seat here. I usually go before 11 am on weekdays, though!

I cannot begin to say enough great things about The Cracked Egg. I think the first thing that I should start with is the fact that after a three year absence from regular visits, I was surprised to see so many familiar faces. The food is always so good here - breakfast or lunch and the friendly staff just adds to that, "I'm know I'm going to return" fact. My favorite part of The Cracked Egg is by far and wide the coffee cake! It's so good!!! Make sure to sign up for their rewards program to get offers and coupons. A great local restaurant that should not be missed.

So this is only 1 of 2 of The Cracked Egg locations that I have tried. 

I have to say it's not a very warm and welcoming feeling when you walk in, we were seated by a hostess that didn't look to sure about what she was doing.

Got our drinks right away by a really nice guy. Ordered our food from the waitress shortly after that. It wasn't very crowded and she came back to the table to double check about something we had ordered.

The food was ok, it was as ordered but some of their stuff is very bland. Burnt toast.

Overall a decent place for the price and amount of food you get, I think I just prefer other locations rather than this one.

Lovely service and yummy food.  I ordered the egg white/turkey scramble with seasoned potatoes and coffee cake.  All were very tasty.  The coffee cake *may* be made from a mix....tasted like a mix cake, but I scarfed it down anyway.  Great place for a casual, fun breakfast/brunch/lunch!

The best breakfast on this side of valley. 
Friendly staff, clean tables excellent coffee. 
Always crowded but that proves their greatness. My wife loves the coffee cake. 
I have a passion for the corned beef. Bring your appetite and plan on taking some of it home. Very full plates.

NOT much of breakfast eater but my cousin from Sac in town and decided too meet up with my brother and my nieces at their favorite breakfast joint. I have been too few times just never got around too reviewing it. One thing really like about The Cracked Egg location so close too the house plus if this one busy then go five min down the road too there free standing restaurant. (I never been). It kind of small place so depending when you go there chance wait. We all meet up on weekend and good thing went early because by 10am the place was insane and line out the door. Go early or late breakfast/lunch crowds not your thing. 

The Coffee Cake the bomb. I went with chili cheese omelette. It was really good! It had right portion of chili and cheese. The seasoned potatoes without doubt MY FAVORITE things on the menu. Sure you seasoned potatoes at any breakfast joint but the thing stands out for me is the seasoning mix they put on them. I have no idea it is. All I know is potatoes are addicting could eat plate of potatoes be in complete bliss. I put some ketchup on them but really tasty eat them by themselves. They nice HOT. Crispy on the outside. I also had the sandwiches on the menu are solid and makes for great breakfast/lunch. One thing after spoiling myself with Red Velvet Pancakes at BabyStack wish they had some too. It one type of pancakes they don;t have but have other yummy options comes too pancakes. Everything on the menu is solid had few things on the menu and loved it!

The service had always been great! Even when its super busy the service always been great, staff if very friendly, and great way too start the day with meal at The Cracked Egg. =))

Just landed in Las Vegas at 6am, finally checked into our hotel room, and boy were we hungry!! So of course, we jumped on Yelp in search for a good breakfast place :)

Finally we founds The Cracked Egg on Yelp. I was super excited because breakfast is my favorite meal of the day! 

The Grub.
[[ CLASSIC EGGS BENEDICT $10.25 ]] http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2#_JzB5Wo5TQvPGwzEXxZZ4w This Benedict comes on a grilled English muffin, Canadian bacon and two poached eggs smothered in hollandaise sauce! 
[[ COUNTRY BENEDICT $11.40 ]] http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2#k7ucRnegPlLeKZ6F1iDl3g The Benedict comes on a biscuit split and topped with patty sausage, two poached eggs and smothered in gravy!
[[ HAM & CHEESE OMELET $9.35 ]] http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2#V_EOo-gE_LcPEzn-Y4Rbbw This omelet is simple and delish! 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to others.
Consistently we have had excellent service and the food is delicious. It's my family's favorite breakfast and brunch restaurant.

This place is a perfect mixed of down home and modern west. The breakfast options were your classics with some staff originals. I love there scrambles. The portions are smaller than most breakfast places and their prices a little higher but over all I had a great experience and differently recommend this spot.

I mean, REALLY, the coffee cake is enough to get my mouth watering. 

I had breakfast here AGAIN this morning with my friend and once again, I was thoroughly impressed. 

Today's coffee cake: apple. The waitress said it was cherry, but it was apple. And it was AMAZING. Warm, soft, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. I can't get enough. I would come here for the coffee cake alone. 

I'm a simple breakfast eater: I eat eggs over easy with toast, hash browns, turkey sausage, and a side of avocado. That's it. 

My friend ordered the sweet potato skillet - not something I would usually order. But, I snuck a bite from her plate and OHMYGOODNESS: FLAVOR EXPLOSION. Sweet potatoes with onions and apples and muenster cheese and bacon and eggs? All of the things you'd never expect in a skillet, but when combined to make the perfect bite, produce the most epic of flavors. 

I will return. As usual. For more coffee cake. And to order the sweet potato skillet.

Hadn't been in a long time, but nothing has changed. The food and service were still very good. I like the atmosphere, location and many breakfast choices. I personally like the eggs Benedict as well as the oatmeal overload.

Always a stellar time! The 'Cheers' of the breakfasts joints, the awesome service is only outdone by the delicious menu.
On the menu today:
-Joes scramble with hash brows 
- Big Bad Wolf with hash browns 
Both entrees come with a side of the most delicious warm and moist coffee cake of my life!! 

Select main entrees have a choice of toast or coffee cake, always choose coffee cake. Lol :) 

With indoor and outdoor seating available the resteraunt is always clean, the service is always incredible and the food is always worth the trip!

Why is food in Summerlin so terrible! Well, it's not terrible, it's just the same crap other restaurants are serving. For example, there is another breakfast place I can't remember the name of (i think Egg was also in the title) that uses the same potatoes as this place, meaning they all get it from the same vendor. The waitress was really pushing us on these crappy, frozen potatoes that looked like they came from Vons. The meals are big portions and ready to give you a heart attack. I just wish the food here wasn't so bland and unoriginal. I like diner food, but jeez, don't serve me the same stuff as every other schlup in Vegas.

Loved this place! Just a few minutes off the strip and it was worth the drive. The service was good, much more relaxed yet still friendly which I appreciated. The service was super quick and the food was delicious! I loved the country benny, definitely a must order.

So yummy! We came because Mr. Mama had a 45 min wait and it was only a 15 min wait here... Long enough for us to look at the menu and make our selection. 

Our server, Liz, was so friendly and if we had won at the casino we would've tipped more, but we gave her a 30% tip. 

French toast was ok, but the coffee cake was sooooo yummy! 

California omlet had a half avocado, which was more than I expected. Perfectly ripe and wish I had taken a pic!

Season potatoes were perfect, no ketchup necessary. 

We plan in returning every time we come to Vegas and tell everyone we know!

My husband and I LOVE this place! We have been coming since they opened. We used to travel to the Rainbow location until they opened the one up near where we live in north las vegas. The food is delicious! They have the best eggs benedict in town and I have tried almost everything in the breakfast menu and everything is great! The atmosphere is great and they have a great staff! Love the service!

Maybe I'm a serial optimist.  Maybe I have to go in to an eatery with a more neutral mind.  I had pretty high expectations for a place that has the word egg in their restaurant name.  I imagined pretty big egg portions for the price.  Alas, it was not.  I had the Northshore scrambler, lots of filler stuff mixed in the egg and it tasted good but if only it were, say, a little bit bigger...maybe by another inch?.  With the Northshore you have a choice of hash browns for diced potatoes.  For some reason, my potatoes arrived cold.  Well, maybe that's overstated.  But, it wasn't hot like my eggs.  Perhaps it's cooked in bulk and left i an aluminum tray.  I also tried the Croissant French Toast with berries.  I'm expecting something way better than IHOP.  The bread was hard upon arrival and it was also cold.  About half the blueberries where sour and half the strawberries were as well. I'm thankful they give you lots of syrup to drown it out.  The highlight of the meal is the nice warm coffee cake that several reviewers state is awesome.  Yes, it is.  I wanted another slice.   The staff are prompt and courteous and checked on us frequently. I like that since it started to get busy as soon as we arrived and server attentiveness usually goes down as the number of customers increase.  We tend to bring a crowd soon after we  arrive, not cause we're famous or even know these people who follow us.  We just seem to be one of Murphy's Laws.  Whether we are at a drive thru at Jack In The Box or in line at the M casino buffett....geez.  Will I go back again? Yes, but it won't be my first choice on my mind.
Coffee cake is amazing. Hash browns were great. Do not have Mexican food here if you know what real Mexican food tastes like. Waffles are the thing here. Coffee is great. Good service.

I went to The Cracked Egg with my wife and father in law for breakfast and had a fantastic meal.  While I'm not a big fan of coffee cake it was by far the best I've ever had.  The real surprise for me though was the potatoe skillet.  The potatoes were browned perfectly with bacon and scallions mixed in.  The service was very quick and the restaurant was surprisingly clean during the busy breakfast hour.

I don't care who you are, but you can't deny breakfast at random times of the day if it's offered to you. That's where The Cracked Egg is a blessing in disguise. 

Your average diner atmosphere, choose among their filling and stuffed omelettes, salads, sandwiches and other breakfast options. (Tip: the pesto omelette is a pretty tasty and healthy post-breakfast dish that tastes less like brunch and is even more perfect for lunch.) 

Did I mention their salads are huge? Yes, huge. So huge, in fact, that you may not want to finish it in one sitting unless you plan on unbuttoning somewhere or another. 

As far as pricing goes, you'll dine on an affordable diner budget. Pay at the counter when you're through, and be thankful you could escape and pretend you're having a Sunday morning brunch instead of a weekday back-to-the-office lunch. Hey, it's what I did.

My absolute favorite breakfast place in all of Las Vegas.  I am so glad they have multiple locations now!

I've been eating here during my Vegas visits for quite a few years now.  I've never once had even a mediocre breakfast here- it's always fabulous!

Fast, comfortable seating, cheap but doesn't taste like it!  Apple filled french past us the bomb!
They also have great turkey sausage, ripe avocado and sourdough toast for healthy add ons.  

Kid friendly; no problems getting a clean high chair here and plenty of other kids in the restaurant...but still quiet enough for a serious chat if need be.

Lively but not crazy loud atmosphere.  Plenty of parking.

I work on S Rainbow near another "Egg" restaurant and had breakfast there every day I worked.
I found The Cracked Egg with the help of Yelp. I went to try it even though it wasn't as convenient. 
This place is awesome, first time was great but waited to try again.
Service is great, friendly staff and food (both things I've tried) is tasty, well prepared and so many things to choose from.
It's to the point that I'm looking forward to work because it starts with breakfast at The Cracked Egg.
Food: Carnitas omelette.. A
     Corned beef skillet.. A
     Can't wait for my next item..
Oh, do yourself a favor and get the coffee cake.. Decedent..

This is no tourist joint as it's way off the strip. What's great about this place is it has a buy 1 get 1 free coupon up to 10 dollars in value from the Las vVgas coupon book. Coffee is 2 dollars and 15 cents a cup. I had Luisa's scramble...3 eggs with sausage, peppers, onions, fresh shrooms, and melted Muenster cheese on top. Came with home fries which were like Ore-Ida, which I didn't care for that much. Also comes with choice of toast or cofee cake. 

The scramble was big and tasty...I would get it again, but would try the hash browns instead of the potatoes/home fries. A bit pricey without the coupon at 9 dollars and 95 cents. This place is clean and the service was fine. 

Pretty funny sign in the bathroom... see my picture. Overall a pretty decent experience but definitely kind of pricey without for a basic diner kinda place. They open at 6 amI and  you can sit wherever you want. They have tables, booths and a bar top.

Great service (our server was Liz). Great prices. Food was very good too. Definitely recommend getting the coffee cake over the toast with your breakfast meal. Had the big bad wolf omelet and it was good. The seasoned potatoes were great too. French toast was cool, but I've has better. But overall this place is great. Would definitely recommend it.

Great place to grab a hearty meal.  Like many reviewers added, this place is far enough off of the strip that you feel a little more relaxed while eating with the locals.

The menu is plentiful and there are many choices for all types of eaters.  The prices are also fair and the wait service is also super friendly.

We went around 11am on the Sunday of Memorial Day weekend and had no problem being seated right away (party of 3).  If I had one complaint it would be about the coffee cake that everyone else raved about.  I wish that they had a variety to choose from per day vs. having a special cake each day.  When we went they had the cherry cream coffee cake and it was just okay.  It had a nice flavor but it was a bit undercooked which gave it a sticky feeling against the tongue.

The food and atmosphere were good enough so we'll definitely head back the next time we are in LV.
This is our first time here, we will FOR SURE be back! The food is AWESOME,  atmosphere is very nice, clean and roomy seating.

Keeping this short. I am a fan of their scrambles and monte cristo. The food quality is better than babystacks. The service is solid as well. Even when they're incredibly busy, the food comes out in a timely fashion.

We love the staff here! We've been coming just about every Saturday and they always remember us/our names/our orders! Carol is so sweet to greet us when we walk in and when we leave: not just a general
"hello/good morning" but something genuine.  The FOOD - you MUST get the seasoned potatoes! I've personally tried a variety of omelettes and all the other types of breakfast dishes and I've yet to have anything I didn't like. Ethan likes the "Jayden" off the kids menu, but he subs our the ham for bacon and no cheese. The kitchen staff always gets it just right and never makes us feel badly for customizing an order (thank goodness, bc kids are difficult at times!) haha. 
This place is always busy, so don't be surprised! They seat you pretty quickly, so don't worry!

Place was ok, I ordered North Shore Scramble and my boyfriend ordered South Shore Scramble. Just standard food, nothing surprising. 

Our waitress was very nice and offered my boyfriend a sub. when he asked for no avocado, that never happens. 

I personally do not like fruit in my coffee cake and wish the waitress told me there is Apple in it before I ordered it. 

If you're looking for a good breakfast joint, go to Egg Works/Egg & I

Was in the neighborhood the other day and decided to stop in for lunch.  Haven't been to this location in awhile and was shocked.  The quality of the food, along with the portion size, has
gone downhill.  Also, the food was marginally warm.  Food should be served hot!  On the plus
side, the service was good.

Solid food for breakfast or lunch. My colleague ordered the tuna melt with seasoned fries. I ordered the tropical French toast. :O... Sorry mouth was watering thinking about how good it was...

The servers and greeters were very friendly and though the place was busy during the lunch hour we were seated quickly. I took in the sights and found French toast on the menu so my mind was set, just had to figure out which version I wanted to try.

The Tropical French toast comes with toasted coconut, macadamia nuts and topped with sliced bananas. I think there was some powder sugar in there too but the food seem to disappear rather quickly! The seasoned fries my colleague enjoyed came with ranch to dip them in and also had he same problem... poof they were gone!

Will definitely come back and try over menu options. Some funny signs on the wall when paying your bill at the front counter. Enjoy the pics :)

Love, love, love this place.  I've been to all of the locations.   When I go to Vegas it's my first stop.  Clean and bright on the inside.  Service is quick.  Food is fresh and tastes great.  The best coffee cake and potatoes anywhere!

This place was great! Fast friendly and efficient. Food was yummy as I had the French toast with over easy eggs and seasoned cut potatoes, all of which were delicious. My husband had an omelette with potatoes and toast which he said was also very good. We also had the coffee and it was some darn good coffee I have to say. Our server was amazing and our total meal only cost $25 ($30 with tip). Highly recommend!

Since breakfast is my most favorite meal of the day, I've tried my fair share of b'fast joints in Vegas; hands down, the best & most consistent b'fast place. The atmosphere is rather simple & quaint, I've liked some things more than others but never had a single complaint about any of the food (the biscuits & gravy initially got me in the door but my latest obsession is the Veggie Benny) & their coffee cake is pure delicious'ness (though I do sometimes wish they'd keep it ol' skool with the raspberry one they had all the time a couple years ago). The only downside is the wait but there's a wait because it's a quality restaurant (so I make sure to plan accordingly).
Excellent food.  Wife and daughter had to try the coffee cake. Omelet was awesome. All in all it was a nice experience. I wpuld definitely recommend it to friends.
Amazing food!!!! If you're in Vegas and don't want to eat buffet style food, please do come here!!! Amazing breakfast

This place has the best breakfast. When I get breakfast, I don't want Denny's, not Ihop, but the Cracked Egg. The country fried steak and wolf omelette is so good. DO NOT GET THE HASH BROWNS. The potatoes are where it's at. Even though there's multiple locations, it doesn't feel like a corporate owned place. I highly recommend this place.
Sometimes busy but worth the wait! Love the food I get here every time. The staff is friendly and service is great even when it's packed!
Perfect morning spot for yummy food! Ask for Erin, she's the best, she will remember you every time with all your special requests! She's a true GEM!
Best breakfast in town if your in vegas loved the food it was extremely delicious. I highly recommend this place as a good spot to eat if you want bomb food will be coming back
Always friendly service.  This is one of my favorite breakfast stops in Vegas.  The coffee cake is something to add to any breakfast, trust me.  Simple home cooked start to your day.
I have been coming here for a few years. And it doesn't matter what I order is always good. Super friendly staff.

I love the Cracked Egg! We stopped by on our way out of town, and I'm so glad we did! 

The coffee is always good, the coffee CAKE is always good... and service is always good! It's the best little breakfast joint a girl could hope for!

Last time I went, I got the egg white omelet, which is something I've never had before. I expected it to taste... healthy. However, I was very surprised at the amazing flavor, because it had peppers and salsa to go with it. It was delicious! And less guilt! (Don't worry - I made up for it with the coffee cake scarfage).

Our whole group loved all the dishes we got, and left with a full belly and smiles on our faces... Now to stay out of our food comas for the car ride back to LA...

Went to breakfast this morning and got some eggs Benedict.... Literally the best eggs Benedict I've ever eaten. Food was amazing and the staff was really friendly, considering how busy it was. I've honestly been going here for years and never wrote a review, so I decided why not throw them five stars. Highly recommended.

This is the place to go for good breakfast food. We always have to wait a bit but it is definitely worth it. Like everyone else has said, TRY THE COFFEE CAKE! Everyone that has tried it with me raves and we fight over who gets the last bite. Service is great and everyone is very friendly. I'm glad this is near my house. It rivals Egg Works for sure.

Gluten free menu is excellent -- a lot of choices and awesome pancakes -- forgot to add the service is great the people who work there are always quick and very warm. Recommend this place to all my gluten free friends

I eat here about two times a week. I LOVE LIZ she is the best server in the place. breakfast, lunch, oatmeal, eggs, burgers youj name it it is all really good. I have been going here for about two years.....YUMMMMMMY

In terms of the decor and atmosphere, it's decent. Food wise, I only remember trying their savory plates! So far, it's been quite delicious! :) I recently tried the Chili Rellenos Omelette, the omelette had a lot of flavor to it and you just can't go wrong with seasoned potatoes at any breakfast place! Right? Their menus are unique looking (like a newspaper)! It can be pretty loud and crowded. I wouldn't say this is one of my top favorite breakfast place, but it's an overall good breakfast place!


P.S. Wait for food can be kind of long sometimes

The service and the food here are phenomenal!! I've been here 2 days in a row. Both days, Liz has been our server. She is super friendly and really shows that she loves her job. She is a true credit to the restaurant and the industry itself. 

In regards to the food, I think my buddy gave the best review I've ever heard. After taking the first bite of warm homemade apple coffee cake, he looks up and with a giant grin says, "This bite made me smile. I feel warm inside!" 

The food here is the epitome of comfort food. My first day, I ordered the Carnitas omelette with a slice of their homemade chocolate chip coffee cake (they have a different flavor of coffee cake every day). The carnitas were so tender and the eggs were cooked to perfection! I held the peppers and onions, but added avocado. 

Today I ordered the bacon cheeseburger skillet with hash browns instead of the country potatoes and a slice of homemade apple coffee cake (told ya they change the flavor every day;). It was amazing! In addition, every time I see skillets, there's usually a pool of oil at the end of meal. Not here my friends! Just pure deliciousness! This is a must stop spot for the Vegas vacation!
They will go above and beyond if you're not happy. Ashley the manager was super helpful. They also have a gluten free menu with great options.

Awesome place to grab brunch on the weekend.  Brace yourself...there will be a long wait, but it is well worth the wait.  

My friend and I ordered two egg dishes, the Greek which had feta, tomatoes and spinach and she ordered the Denver which had spinach, cheese and bacon in it.  Both of them were absolutely amazing!  The Greek was very tasty and super flavorful.  I think the spinach could have been left off, but it was still good.

Both dishes come with your choice of hash browns, toast and coffee cake.  Get the coffee cake.  They have differently flavors every time you attend and its not like normal coffee cake found at Starbucks.  Its super fluffy and light and the flavors are super amazing.  The oreo coffee cake was great!

I would totally come there again the next time I come back to visit.

I have been here twice. Both times the service and friendly demeanor was exceptional. The food was great!

Little story: the first time I was at this location I had planned to meet a friend here. I was waiting and waiting. the server brought me a coffee... finally i decided that my friend and I had mixed up our locations so i went to the front to pay for my coffee and the person at the cash register (i'm assuming the owner or at least manager), so "no problem, honey, coffee is on us" - I was blown away by their generosity and realized that this is the way all businesses should do business... no where else I can think of would be this kind.

Another reviewer (Kish M.) states, "Remember, there's only so much that you can do with eggs, toast, and bacon" - and yet, somehow, this place managed to fuck up every variation my family tried. You have to work at it, really hard, to make Eggs Benedict unpalatable. You have to expend concerted effort to make scrambled eggs so dry and unappealing that even my kid, the scourge of all eggs,  won't eat them. I don't even remember what my wife ordered, but she gave up after two bites, because it was revolting.
1 angry hangover + 1 large, steaming bowl of fresh, made in small batches says the chef oatmeal + berries, granola, brown sugar and milk.. = less painful reality and happy food belly.

Our dining experience was amazing! Our server was very kind and our food came quickly, even though it was a full house. Our food was flavorful and filling. The coffee cake that was available for the day was Lemon, I was a little hesitant to try it but I'm glad I did! It was delicious!

The Cracked Egg is very overrated.  For a breakfast place, it's just okay.  There are many other coffee shops in Vegas that serve a better breakfast.  I ate there twice only because I had a groupon.  I would not eat there if I had to pay full price.

I enjoyed. Would have enjoyed even more had they had mimosas  lol - but that's just me tho. 
Very friendly server, food was really good. I'll be back. I have a pic but this silly Yelp app won't let me add it.
I come here at 12 for lunch sometimes , and it a great place, the Turkey melt is what I always get. Their season potatoes is a must! . Would always recommend to anyone .

The food here is great.  I made my own skillet and the stuff weighed like 3 lbs, and I happened to finish it all.  The service was excellent, the quality was amazing, and the coffee cake was pretty damn good.

It is a little pricey just for breakfast, but I believe you get your bang for your buck.  They have a pretty good selection on their menu.  I'll definitely be back there again next time I'm in Vegas.
Raspberry stuffed french toast.......enough said

Great breakfast spot.  The Coffee cake is very soft and moist. I want more!
Cracked egg sandwich was good.  
Lucy scramble was normal.
Overall,  good breakfast  spot.

I've always enjoyed a good breakfast. Mom always said that it's the days most important meal - here, breakfast never fails. 

I've been going to this location for a few years now. Im there for lunch half the time, and the other half is when I call in for a pick up. 

Denny's doesn't even come close. The reason I like it here is because I like Cracker Barrel. So if you're looking for a Cracker Barrel alternative - find your nearest Cracked Egg.

Hungry fam was in search for good breakfast place in our new area. I think we found it. Wasn't as busy, sat our family down of 5 on arrival. Our waitress "Tracey" was amazing and really nice. She took our orders by memory and repeated it back to us accurately. She recommended the peanut butter and jelly coffee cake which was the BOMB. It was moist and warm. I could go back for just coffee and coffee cake. My husband and I shared a country fried steak with gravy, didn't know we could do half Hash brown and half seasoned potatoes and that's what we did. Country fried steak was good, it wasn't as heavy. So I didn't feel bad eating it. The kids got the banana choc chip with eggs and bacon. Also the Monte cristo which was some sort of ham and cheese stuff French toast if im not mistaken. 

Overall, the experience was great. Great food, great staff, food was quick, reasonable price (maybe a tad higher) but with all said and eats...we will be back! 

Thank you Yelpers for the pick! Happy eats!!
Always has an amazing staff.. food is always up to par.. great prices and even better environment.. definitely my favorite place to eat breakfast!
As solid as a place like this gets. This is run of the mill breakfast diner food consistently executed very well and with great service.

I like this cute breakfast restaurant more than a few of the other similar pancake/omelette/Benedict places we've been to. Felt cleaner too. Our server was one of the sweetest.. the type of girl who will brighten your morning without over doing it. She was more than helpful, again, without overdoing it. Wish I remembered her name.. brunette with a pixie haircut and i think she had a small tat on the back of her neck.. tiny frame, sweet eyes & smile. Sorry .. girl crushing for a split sec there. Anyway, we went on a Sunday and the wait was long of course but it was worth it. Love the booth seating and the service overall was perfect, especially on such a busy morning. Oh and our meal was delicious. I had the Veggie Benny and hubby had Buttermilk Pancakes, scrambled eggs and an order of bacon & sausage. Omg soo good.

This is a great little place for breakfast. They offer lunch items, too. Although, I have only had breakfast. the atmosphere is great & small. The staff is friendly & prompt. Everyday the offer a coffee cake (instead of toast if you prefer) & it is never the same flavor. Its nice to have something different everyday, You can also get all egg white at no extra charge. I highly recommend this place. My son only wants to eat here for breakfast. Which is fine by me.

Top of the line breakfast! Been going there for 4 years straight. Love the stuffed peanut butter jelly French toast. But my favorite will always be the orange marmalade French toast yummy!! Great service great environment great attitude.

Best breakfast I've had in  years id say!!! Super clean, super neat, wonderful customer service, and for the first time you get what you pay for! 
Not the cheap diner places where everything tastes the same, and not  the fancy shmancy brunch places where you pay $40 for eggs! 
To bad is 260 miles away for me, but for sure anytime id go to vegas id stop there!
Love this place and we go all the time. Awesome coffee cake and delicious egg dishes! Always hard to choose which one to get - they're all so good!!

I just love their pancakes here! 

The service here is usually good. We've been coming here every weekend for breakfast and the staff knows us already. But there are times that we will be seated with servers who are not as attentive. 

But the food is always good. No complaint so far.

Every time I come here it gets better and better. I've loved everything I've eaten from here! Everyone is so nice too. 
The coffee cake is a must. Even if it's a flavor that doesn't sound too appealing, they do it WELL. 
I come here every time I'm in Vegas. They need to open one in California and I'll go broke

I love this place for breakfast, and it has some of the best New England Clam on fridays.  I am a big fan of the hangover special they have occasionally, and have yet to have a dish I didn't like there.  You have to try the coffee cake.

i am a breakfast girl. morning, afternoon, and my favorite...night! i went here for a late breakfast one morning after the boy constantly hints that he craves it. he use to be a regular here apparently and i caught that as soon as we walked in. the servers knew him and remembered him (by name) all the way to what he orders. he loves the lowfat scramble without any green chilis. i ordered the veggie benny. (i'm a sucker for the benedicts and i love veggies.) 
the waitresses and waiters were all very nice and attentive. the food came quickly. we had a bagel and banana in the meantime to snack on. when my veggie benny came i was in love with all the bright colors of it. pretty food! the only thing i didn't care for was when they said "smothered in holliandaise sauce" they really meant it. it took away some of the flavor of my fresh spinach and tomatos sadly. next time i will have to make sure to ask them to go easy. we shared my seasoned potatos and those were pretty good. greasy but good.
i would give it 3 stars because it was pretty basic and for the holliandaise factor, but the service made me want to come back. everyone was very nice and the bill was cheap.

Standard breakfast and brunch only establishment. 

So far have only tried a GVP omelet, club sandwich and the huevos rancheros. Nothing special taste-wise, but the service was fairly fast, as is the common expectation in these types of eateries.

Expect a 10-20 minute wait on weekends. Never been there during the workweek.
Great service, seated us right away. Food delicious especially the coffee cake! Would visit again

This breakfast place is absolutely " gross" and certainly not what peopled 
"Jacked"this place to be this great breakfast place . My omelette was tasteless and cold . And the infamous coffee cake......really .. I will not return 
The service was poor . The food is overpriced, and certainly not worth the
Drive. The reputation of this establishment does not meet the quality. Extremely disappointing!,,,,,,,

Great omelletes!  Even though the wait was painfully long, definitely worth the wait.

It is an A+ alternative to the chain breakfast diners!

Will return!

Had the gluten free turkey Pesto sandwich. The bread was delicious and had a perfectly made Pesto sauce. May have to go back on this trip to have again. Also got the side of fruit. Had delicious pieces of watermelon, cantaloupe and grapefruit. As we were leaving it was really filling up. Popular place for great reason!

The service here is good but the food isn't anything special...

Its a great place to grab a quick breakfast. Typical breakfast menu plus some healthy choices.
Went on a Saturday morning....no waiting, got a table immediately.  Food was great and waitress was awesome.  Better than other Cracked Eggs I've been too in Vegas.

Delicious food. Good coffee. Very friendly. Food portions were average for Las Vegas, my youngest had pancakes with eggs and bacon, pancakes were large, fluffy and moist. Hubby had corn beef hash with over easy eggs and it was hash as I have never seen it, like cut up slices of corn beef, tasted pretty good and not greasy at all. Older daughter had egg burrito with chorizo, she loved every bit and opted for fresh fruit in place of potatoes,  pieces of watermelon, cantaloupe and grapefruit. I had scrambled eggs with green onion and cream cheese, side of hash browns and in place of toast; coffee cake, coffee cake was amazing. Super moist and perfect amount of cinnamon, delicious. My eggs with cream cheese and green onions were flavorful and moist. Coffee hot and strong, service fast friendly and server stopped by many times to refill beverages. Bathroom cramped but very clean. Only 4 stars because I feel the price was a bit high. Over 50.00 for our meal. I don't know if that is average for off the strip, but for us So. Cal family it's a bit high. With all that said, will go back again.

I been coming to "Cracked Egg" for some years now. I been to mostly all the locations around the Vally! And I can say that I've always had a great and good experience! The service the staff always very great at customer service and very welcoming! Not to mention the food here is amazing!!!!!! I will always be loyal customer

It started off rocky for us, place was packed full I was shocked we walked in and were seated right away.  Country themed, clean, calming and relaxing.  I really didn't care for the Corned Beef hash & my boyfriend's French toast was kind of sad, and too dark. We asked for the Manager,  Ashley was so nice she asked if she could get us anything else we'd like... we were unsure.  I decided I was craving French toast and I really can't eat it because I'm allergic to wheat.  So I ordered it for myself but really I was planning on eating two bites and making the bf have it since his first order was just bad.  The French toast was delicious the second time around, nice golden brown.  By that time the place has cleared out and I decided maybe I will get something I can eat since they passed my "french toast test". Let's be honest if a brunch place can't nail French toast I wouldn't of stuck around.

So I wasn't crazy about the Corned beef hash serving I had, I figured I'll come back and try it another day maybe without onion next time and decided on the "garden omelet" it has mushroom and spinach on it.  I ordered it from the Gluten Free menu, totally loved the fresh ingredients veggies and melted cheese.  

**They're Gluten Free Menu is the biggest I've seen anywhere ELSE!**

We plan on going back and bringing more friends/family here because I prefer this place over the Egg & I.  I want to try the coffee next time too. I don't know what I was thinking a soft drink with Lunch.

Gluten-free and Las Vegas doesn't go well together.  When you do find a breakfast place that does cater to the gluten-free people in Vegas, you have to visit!  We wanted breakfast, but nothing on the strip is gluten-free friendly.  We searched online and found "The Cracked Egg."  A local breakfast spot that has three locations in Vegas that indeed caters to people eating gluten-free!  We were excited and drove to the south Vegas location.

After going the wrong way off the freeway, we turned around and found "The Cracked Egg."  It is in a nice little outdoor strip mall/  Easy to find once you get going the right way. Upon walking in, we were greeted by the hostess, told them we would like the gluten-free menu and that we wanted to eat outside on their patio.  If you get a chance and it isn't 100 degrees outside yet, take advantage of eating outside on the patio!

The gluten-free menu is two full pages!  Yes...you can order gluten-free pancakes and french toast here!!  After studying the menus, we decided upon an omelet and a scramble. Both were huge portioned and VERY, VERY delicious!  It's places like this that makes me love breakfast food!

The staff here is very friendly and helpful.  They always had a smile on their faces.  Oh...I can't forget...they have those chocolate mints up at the cash register.  The pricing is a few dollars more than I expected, but it's a breakfast spot and it's in Vegas.

While it may not be on the strip, "The Cracked Egg" is about only a 5-10 min. drive away.  It well worth the drive to have a breakfast that's delicious and gluten-free!

My boyfriend and I came in on a Saturday morning and let me just say that this place was PACKED. We asked if we could sit at the bar without waiting and they said it was first come first serve so we grabbed two seats. The server was very attentive and made sure our drinks were always filled (huge deal for me). She recommended the coffee cake as one of our sides and it was pretty good. Our main food was alright it wasn't anything special and really over priced but the customer service was off the charts! Would maybe go back and try something different! The pancakes are HUGE a short stack is more than enough!

I've dined here before and the food has always been good except for today when I ordered the huevos rancheros. It is the worst huevos I have ever eaten. Service was good just sub par food. I would either improve the dish or take it off the menu..

Really nice breakfast joint. Get the coffee cake vs toast. Wow. Just wow. I had the Mexican skillet with salsa verde. Chorizo was perfect. Salsa verde was sweet but fit the dish perfect with the picked jalapeños. You won't be disappointed

My wife and I went to The Cracked Egg today for a late breakfast - what can I say? We like to sleep in on Sundays.

I probably ordered badly choosing a sandwich at what is undeniably a breakfast joint, I can't recall the name, but it was roast beef, red onion, tomato and lettuce on sourdough sliced bread with "horseradish mayonaise" - The sandwich was of undeniable high quality, but I was disappointed that I couldn't detect any distinctive horseradish taste in the mayo - it just tasted like standard Best Foods to me. I quite enjoyed the seasoned potatoes that accompanied my meal.

Wife had a skillet of some sort involving scrambled eggs with cream cheese and scallions, some hash browns and toasted English muffins. She enjoyed the lot, although wasn't so impressed with her hash browns - we both have very exacting standards when it comes to these.

Overall we were prettty happy with our meal there - I would definitely order differently next time. For a ten buck sandwich I received something too close to what I could easily slap together at home, but the menu is reasonably extensive and the place was doing a roaring trade late Sunday morning. We will be back for further exploration.
Love this place! My favorite breakfast/brunch spot. Always good food and good service.
Very friendly, every dish was great, quick and hot! We had no problems substituting or adding to out plates and the coffee cake was soooo good!!

There is no better place to go for a great, easy breakfast in Vegas for the price.

They have such a wide selection of egg dishes for breakfast, delicious stuffed french toast, a wide range of lunch selections... total food boner.

The eggs are always done perfectly, the toast is crisp but not burnt, the service is excellent... it's an awesome modern diner.

Also, Cracked Egg is giving Poppy's Frozen Yogurt a run for its money with the jailbait cashiers.
We came here the morning after a wedding with a large group of 12. Cory our waitress was so sweet and made sure our meal was perfect. The food was delicious and we will return to see her soon.

I came in a with a Groupon to give this place a try

Wasn't expecting much...  so I was blown away with great service, good biscuts and gravy, and the best Monte Cristo I've had in decades 

I'll be back as soon as I can work off the calories

This place is so good. The skillets are by far the best I've ever had. They make a new batch of coffee cake when they run out and it's always a different flavor. I wish I had known that before I came because I ended up with strawberry peanut butter and it was definitely very different. It wasn't bad but it wasn't what I was expecting. This little place is about 5 minutes from the strip and it was packed when I came on a Monday morning

At last: edible breakfast in Las Vegas.

Husband and I have tried so many breakfast spots in Vegas that it's not even funny, and they have ranged from "meh" to "OMG no." This is the first time we've really enjoyed the breakfast foods we ordered.

I am aware some of you will immediately reject this review because you think Vegas breakfasts taste just like breakfast anywhere else. I love you, but this review is not for you.

For those of who you KNOW that tasty breakfast isn't really Vegas' *thing*, come HERE. This place is good.

The pancakes, etc. were NOT tasteless. The fruit was actually ripe. The Hollandaise was delicious and generously given. The coffee was actually good!

Literally the only thing that might be annoying is the condescending signage. (They actually have the "There is no Wi-Fi. Talk to each other. Pretend it's 1995." To which I say: https://mostlysignssomeportents.tumblr.com/post/92606477500/dunebat-coldswarkids-edwardspoonhands  )

It is with a SPIRIT OF TRUE IRONY that I leave this review for them online, which is where we FOUND this place, and which would not have been possible in 1995. Ha!

Finally! A place with gluten free blueberry pancakes. my 2nd all time favorite food :) I've been here like 5 times in the past two weeks and its so good. The side of fruit is amazing too. grapefruit slices, blackberries, raspberries, strawberries, and sliced melon! 
Fresh squeezed orange juice is the cherry on top to an amazing meal. The staff is very friendly and accommodating as well. My new favorite breakfast spot :)

This place is clearly popular since the wait to get in is usually 20 minutes. The problem is their inability to keep track of who is waiting and for how long. I took two friends here today, was told a 20 minute wait. After 35 minutes, I asked the girl at the desk who said "there's just two people in front of you." I sat on a bench in front of this person for the next 20 minutes as they sat group after group. After seeing at least 5 groups get seated, I asked again, only to be met with confused looks and NO apology. I could see the panic as the front end staff tried to figure out what they could do, which should have been seat us immediately. That didn't happen so we left. I won't be going back to this place ever again.

Laid back basic breakfast place. Inside it reminds me of a breakfast place in So. Cal. I like the feel of it. Have had a variety of dishes. After trying different meals, I usually stick with one of the basic eggs + dishes. Hot links and Eggs are my fave right now. Spicy! Not too too spicy though. 

Was not impressed with the coffee cake. Was expecting something denser, with a crumble but this was like Angel food cake with strawberry jam and a drizzle of icing. Not my thing. Coffee was pretty good, they could have kept it coming but were quite busy.

All in all, they deliver just what I expect of a breakfast place, though I would prefer to be happily surprised.

On vacation & looking for something other than a buffet.  Found this place on yelp & it didn't disappoint.  We walked right in with no wait to sit.  We ordered kids chocolate chip pancakes with a side of bacon (3 slices) and scrambled eggs w/cheddar cheese & bacon with (not so) season potatoes & coffee cake.  The coffee cake came out warmed right away.  This is not your average coffee cake.  Its light and fluffy similar to an angel cake with strawberry & apple inside.  Apparently the flavor changes day to day - surprise.  We played 4 games of tic tac toe & the food arrived - that was quick.  The eggs were cooked perfectly.  The potato were very bland.  My son gobbled up his pancakes but was full about 1 1/2 cakes through.  He said he was glad we chose this place - score.  Also the waitress was great.  Prices are about average.  I would definitely come back.

Some of the best breakfast in town! The hostesses are young and ditzy sometimes, but the waitress we usually get is always super nice and attentive. The coffee cake NEVER fails and is always delish, no matter what flavor! I highly suggest the Taylor's scramble, build your own skillets, and the oatmeal. It's not your average oatmeal. Comes with half and half, raisins, granola, fresh berries, brown sugar, etc. It is the best oatmeal I have ever eaten and the ingredients and so fresh. If you join their breakfast club, they send you coupons in the mail all the time too. There really isn't a bad thing to say about this place, except that if you get there between 9-10am, you are going to wait a while for a seat! My boyfriend and I visit at least twice a month!

The Cracked Egg is a solid breakfast restaurant that also serves lunch items as well. My husband and I don't go here often as we prefer other breakfast places around town. 

Let's start with the service - I've never gone into The Cracked Egg and had a negative experience. The staff is always friendly and polite. Also, they're very attentive and your drink cup is seldom empty. Sometimes there is a bit if a wait to get seated, especially on weekends. 

Now let's get into the grub - Their food is good. I wouldn't call it delicious, but it's pretty tasty. I ordered the Benedict Ole for $11.40. This breakfast includes two eggs benedict, but instead of ham, it comes with chicken and green chiles. I got to choose between shredded hashbrowns or seasoned potatoes; I chose the hashbrowns. As I said, the meal was pretty good, but the flavors were nothing that left me wanting more. The hashbrowns were also pretty standard. 

Overall, The Cracked Egg is a solid breakfast joint, but if you want to give other places around town a chance, I think you can find better. Also, their prices aren't really competitive when compared to other eateries. For two egg benedicts with hashbrowns, I paid almost $12.00. You can get more bang for your buck elsewhere.

Went here for breakfast after dropping my little dude off to preschool. Not crowded at all so I took a seat at the counter. The menu was quite extensive and I REALLY REALLY wanted the Peanut Butter French Toast with honey and bananas....however...I had a hot yoga class at 10 am and didn't want to puke in the middle of it. I opted for an egg white omelet, seasoned potatoes and sourdough toast. Also I decided to throw in a coffee and fresh squeezed grapefruit juice (no joke...it was fresh squeezed). It was delightful. Perfectly cooked, seasoned and yummy. Will be back there many times when I have to take the kids to school.

I had the Green Scramble with egg whites, no cheese, and chocolate chip coffee cake ($11.00). I also had two banana chocolate chip pancakes with sugar free syrup.

The scramble was good. The seasoned potatoes are nothing special, just heavily seasoned fried potatoes, basically french fries in a different shape. 

The coffee cake was great.  Though I'm not sure I've ever had bad coffee cake.  When will sugary bread not taste good?  Downside is you have to have whatever kind of coffee cake they have for the day, but that can also be a good thing because it takes out having to rack your brain to decide.  Would love to try their other flavors.

The banana chocolate chip pancakes were excellent! They were made just right. And I had sugar free syrup.

I also used a 2 for 1 coupon. Without it, it's a tad pricey, but so is every other good breakfast place I suppose.

The one in Henderson was my favorite breakfast spot! This is my first time at this location.
I ordered the chicken fried steak with eggs.
The refs were delicious and he seasoned potatoes are my favorite food item they make! 
The chicken fried steak was also delicious but my minor complaint is there isn't enough gravy! I'll order an extra side of it next time.

Come here, get the seasoned potatoes. 
The service was fast and decent as well. 
I'll be back for sure.
This place is mediocre. There's nothing unique about it. I ordered a croissant french toast and it was stale. The side of eggs were horrible. Customer service was okay. Overall, jst one time try.

My love affair with The Cracked Egg started at this location and migrated to the Cheyenne location when I bought a home in Summerlin.

I'm still partial to this location mainly because it is more spacious and has a really light, fun ambiance to it. Their food is always fresh and interesting and I've never had a bad meal here. I tried the Vaquero omelet which had green chilis, chorizo, salsa, and lots of cheese, sour cream, and salsa smothered on top. This was one heavy, flavorful dish but the eggs were still fluffy and made me want to nom nom nom all day. The sourdough toast was also really interesting and I'd definitely get that again, that's for sure! If you are looking for something lighter you need to try the banana walnut pancakes because they are heavenly.

If you are in search of a solid, inexpensive breakfast with a fun atmosphere and friendly waitstaff then eat at The Cracked Egg and thank me later.
What a place and what a price!  Just great service, food and atmosphere!  People were very friendly and food was just fabulous! Will visit again when we are in town!

So delicious!!!!! If you come here better try their seasoned fries they are the best. I had the garden omelette with broccoli, spinach, tomatoes and cheese so good! My husband had philly chicken sandwich so good too!! I really recommend this place! Oh and one other thing out bill was like 20 bucks!!

The breakfast here is so good! We have our favorites like the big bad wolf and the pesto scramble but, make out a point to try new things too! The coffee cake is to die for and is always freshly made. The staff is so friendly, giving it a down home flavor. Definitely one of our favorite breast places!

Breakfast, breakfast, and more breakfast! If you want breakfast, and want it done well, go to The Cracked Egg!

THE FOOD: With my usual craving to devour everything on the menu, it's always a challenge to decide on what to order, especially at breakfast because it's my favorite meal of the day. I ended up ordering the Cakes & Eggs Combo so I could get a little bit of everything. The eggs were cooked to perfection, and the sausage patties were flavorful. DON'T get the sausage links, the waiters/waitresses even recommend against it, hahaha. The pancakes were really good too! The right amount of fluffiness drenched in an ocean of syrup (I did that myself, of course). 

The Cracked Egg also serves coffee cake, and it's apparently somewhat popular. I had the opportunity to eat some of this coffee cake, and it was...chocolate...coffee cake? I really don't know how to explain it any better than that. It was okay, it just tasted like a dry chocolate cake with coffee cake crumble on top. Other people have told me they have had other types of coffee cake, so I'm guessing The Cracked Egg likes to change things up. If you're curious, I would ask the staff.

The staff is another topic. I didn't think they were very friendly. The woman who seated us (my mom, my stepdad, and I) practically threw our menus and utensils on the table without saying a word, and returned to the front of the restaurant. Our waitress was also very quick in wanting to get us to leave when the restaurant wasn't even half full.

THE VERDICT: Overall, the food is fantastic. The staff, not so much. I'll go back for the food, especially since I love a place that does breakfast well.

Have been here twice. Having had a hard time finding a decent breaky in the area, was happy to find. Typical breakfast place with extremely friendly and attentive service. 

Both times got the eggs benedict with spinach added. Was perfect for what I was looking for. I'll return.

Ordered here while on a vacay in Vegas while staying at a nearby airbnb. Good solid breakfast food at reasonable price. Good variety of omelettes gluten free, high protein, vegetarian - something for everybody! , Love that most breakfast items cane with a choice of coffee cake which we all ate as breakfast the next day.

A great place for Breakfast.  My wife and I...tired of the expensive Las Vegas Strip foods...and the cheap buffet's off strip buffet's, decided to give "The Cracked Egg" a try.  We were not disappointed!  The menu is extensive...and most dishes are priced an average of $11.  We are skillet crazed and the Egg delivered! I had the "Bacon-Cheeseburger Skillet" and my wife had a build your own skillet with sausage, tomato's, onions and cheese.  Cheeseburger for breakfast you say?  It was just chock full of ground beef, plenty of cheese, home style potatoes and fresh bacon galore.  I added a side of hollandaise to top my perfectly cooked eggs over easy and voila...taste perfection.  No skimping here.  The place was typical strip mall diner style seating...the staff friendly and helpful...all in all a great place to catch a great hearty breakfast! 

 Hungry for lunch...check the backside of the menu for sandwiches, burgers etc.  But the breakfast is the draw..I mean...it is called "The Cracked Egg" afterall.

I like coconuts. I like french toast. I like fruit. So, the tropical french toast was an obvious pick. Loved it. The portions were huge and enough for two people. Other stuff i've tried on previous visits include:

- croissant french toast: not my favorite, the french toast croissant was too mushy

- raspberry stuffed french toast: delicious

- chocolate chip pancakes: good, but nothing spectacular

- philly cheesesteak: surprisingly good, a little on the small side, chicken was very tender, plenty of onions and peppers, bread was nice and chewy and fresh

The service tends to be on the slow side no matter the day or time. The last time I went was a Monday morning and there were maybe 2 other groups in whole place. It still took a while to get my order in. Didn't see my waitress again until we flagged her down to get the check. But, you're not paying for the service or ambiance. Just good breakfast and lunch food.

Good customer service is as crucial as good food. Although the food was quite delicious, the bad service we experienced left a horrible taste in my mouth.

My husband and I went for Sunday brunch and the hostess told us the wait would be about 20 minutes. The wait area inside was full so we waited outside with about 15 other people. We figured with this many people waiting that this place had to be good. About 25 minutes later, my husband checked with the hostess and she said she called his name about 20 minutes ago. Funny thing was that while my husband was inside talking to the hostess, a party of 5 next to me complained that they were never called and the hostess insisted she called them. They were more bothered (as was I) that the hostess insisted she called their name and didn't apologize for the inconvenience. A group of 4 who just paid walked out and were complaining about the rudeness of the hostess! Three groups complaining about the bitchiness of the hostess is not a coincidence!

When we were finally seated, the hostess dropped our menu and our silverware on the table, didn't say a word and walked away. WOW. We waited a while for our waitress and she also had a sour attitude! I even asked my husband if I was just imagining things but agreed that she was not pleasant at all.

As I was making mental notes about what I should rant in my Yelp review, the coffee cake came out and managed to bring what was supposed to be a 2 star review to a 2.5/3. It was moist and heavenly!

My husband ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and it was decent but not the best we've ever had. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and I loved the hollandaise and the thickness of the ham. The seasoned potatoes were the perfect complement to the eggs.

Note to the management of The Cracked Egg: Bad attitude can really ruin a customer's service. On busy weekends, please ensure your hostesses and wait staff are smiling and friendly.  I would suggest to invest in pagers because it can be difficult to hear the hostesses when there are 15 people waiting outside and planes flying overhead. With Egg Works opening up down the street in Fall 2011, I doubt I'd come back here because of bad attitude I encountered even though the food was good.

This was ok, the coffee cake was great, but we didn't get our drinks refilled even once.

I wouldn't avoid this place but I wouldnt go out of my way to go there regardless of how hungry I am. 

Croissant french toast, wasn't that great, it kind of tasted like only the heels of a standard loaf of bread.

Immediately greeted upon entering and seated. Waitress was attentive to us and provide excellent customer service. We had several staff approach us immediately after seated to get our drink order.  Food was fresh, hot and arrived quick. We waited maybe 10 minutes for our food once we order. Our coffee cup was never empty. Highly recommend this place

The Cracked Egg is a great spot for breakfast if you're looking for that local, homey feel. I went on a weekday and the restaurant was full. There was about a 5-10 minute wait. which was tolerable. It went by very quick though especially since I spent my time looking over their extensive egg menu.

So extensive that I still needed time to look over the menu even after I was seated, but then again I'm really slow when it comes to ordering food so that could have been the reason why. 

I ended up with an egg white "Garden Patch" omelet. It was fully loaded with spinach, broccoli, mushrooms, tomatoes, and cheese. It was so huge that I couldn't even finish it, but it was delicious!! Also, my dish came with hash browns (or seasoned potatoes if you want) and coffee cake (or toast). 

It was a great breakfast and a great way to kick off the morning! I recommend checking this place out!

Made a to go order from here. Food was fresh and portions were very large. Food was ready about 15 minutes after we placed our order over the phone.  

The country fried steak was okay though we weren't a big fan of the gravy. The gravy was a little bland. The country potatoes were also lacking a little flavor in my opinion. The kickin' potatoes were good though perhaps because they were covered in crispy bacon and cheese. Can't go wrong with bacon and cheese. 

I did enjoy the Mexican skillet and the scrambled eggs were cooked just right. Probably would've been great with flour tortillas but the rye toast was a sufficient side. Overall not bad. Next time I'll have to try their eggs Benedict.
One of my favorite breakfast spots! I work nights, and come after I get off of work. Everyone is friendly, food is always good. If you haven't had the raspberry French toast, you're missing out!

Great service and food! They have gluten and diary free pancakes which is something I can never find at a restaurant. They were amazing!! Plus their seasoned potatoes are full of so much flavor. Definitely would recommend and go back!

We wanted a breakfast away from strip and found this place on Yelp. We only waited 3 minutes and seated outside.  At 11 am, it was nice and in shade.  Our party had an omelet and skillet breakfast.  Husband had senior special. The overall experience was great.  The food was good and and satisfying.  The service was exceptional starting with the adorable hostess, who looked like she may have been an owner.

I really love this place, once we found this gem we've been going back every time we are in Vegas.  The avocado Benedict is my absolute favorite thing to eat there.  Just an awesome place to get breakfast!

I've had the pleasure of eating here a couple times and I had a great experience both times. 

There is several reasons why I love this place and gave it 5 stars. The staff is very friendly and attentive, they have a huge selection of delicious good quality food and their prices are good. I ordered the cakes and egg combo it comes with pancakes, 2 eggs any style I got scrambled with cheese and also your choice of bacon or sausage I got sausage. Now I know it sounds basic but it was probably the best pancakes and sausage I have ever had from a restaurant the pancakes were fluffy goodness and the sauce was nice and juicy I ate every bite of my plate which is rare for me. 

My bf got the chicken fried steak which he devoured in a blink of an eye luckily i grabbed a bite before he finished it off and that too was also delicious ill be getting that next time we go here. 

This place is a winner for sure!

I love this place. I found it on a whim a few years ago while staying on the strip. During this trip to Vegas, I've been twice. The gluten free pancakes are amazing, the service is always good, and the coffee is fresh. I really enjoy my food and the time I have! Apparently, the coffee cake is great. The smell is incredible. Thanks for having such amazing gluten free pancakes.

One of my favorite places to grab breakfast, and I always drag my dad here when he's visiting. I'm a fan of their Joe's Scramble and the Garden Benny; my husband likes the corned beef hash and the southern style eggs benedict. I've also enjoyed their seasonal items like pumpkin pancakes.

They always take great care of us when we visit, almost always with my kiddo in tow. It can get a bit crowded, especially on weekends, but it's always worth the wait.
I have to have breakfast here every time I visit! This place does breakfast right! The French toast is amazing, the coffee is delicious , the service is great!

"GVP"- seasoned potatoes were definitely our favorite. Crunchy and delectable! Perfectly seasoned! The omelette itself was good. A lot of avocados which was a plus. I just wish the omelette was a little more juicier per se. Typical omelette though, nothing outstanding.. The potatoes were def the best thing about this dish. 

Tropical French toast: really good! Sweet. Lots of sweet fruits. This definitely caught my attention and was pretty unique. 

Coffee bread: overhyped! But it's still good, but our least favorite dish of our selection.

The service was pretty good. Atmosphere was nice as well!

My fiance and I have been coming here almost every Sunday for the past three years. I love everything about it. The waitstaff is extremely friendly and they're always smiling and upbeat. The service is great, even when it's extremely busy, which it usually is on Sundays. I've never had to worry about someone coming to refill my coffee, they always come around and offer refills at the perfect times. The coffee itself is GREAT. Best coffee at a restaurant I think I've ever had, and it's always served hot and tastes fresh. The food has never been disappointing. I tend to order the same two menu items frequently, but any time I try something new it's always good. The only remotely negative thing about this place is it's very popular so there does tend to be a wait time when we come in. However it's usually only 10 minutes tops and I think it's well worth the wait.  I will continue to come here every Sunday for as long as it's open.

I've been coming here for about 5-6 months since I started working at the building nearby. This place has great food and a big menu to choose from. There have been a few times when they make mistakes with the order, but that's fine, mistakes happen sometimes.

What really upset me today, is since I started coming here, I signed up for the rewards program, which was just a paper that you fill up and you hand to them and they give you a card. When I handed them the filled out paper, they said I'm all set, and they even scanned my card that day so I can get the points for my order. 

Today, I decided to log in to the rewards card site to see how much points I have, I was shocked as it said, "No e-mail is associated with this card number." I went and ordered food, and when I got to the restaurant, I mentioned the card issue, and the girl said, "You were suppose to verify your e-mail from the e-mail that was sent to you."

I checked my e-mail and there was never an e-mail sent to me. Does this mean that you guys never even activated my card? All those times that you "inserted" my card so I can get my points were all fake? That's not right! and That's not nice! 

That means all the points I should have had for the past 5-6 months, was nothing! I literally order here once or twice a week! I could have accumulated a lot of points already! 

I am very unhappy and wish for this to be fixed. Other than this situation, this place is great! I will re-write a review if this is fixed.

Great local spot in Vegas. This is our second time here.
We came for breakfast here the other morning, service was awesome, food was awesome- so much so that we came again for breakfast today.
Only bummer about this morning there is a wait to be seated, the entire waiting area is full of people waiting - so my husband and I waited outside.... Summer, 100 degree weather at 11:00 am- ugh.
If you do come- try the coffee cake. It's a very light airy type cake. Not your typical dense coffee cake. Plus, this one has peach;) 
But the French Toast is delicious, compared to other places I eaten. The Eggs Benedict too.
Just a super cute little spot to grab breakfast.
Simply yummy! The scrambles are so good, especially when you get them with the seasoned potatoes and coffee cake.

F* b-i-t-c-h waitress gave us the worst service. I was nice about it, signed for the bill and still gave her a standard 15% tip. Guess what this b-i-t-c-h did? she changed the tip amount, and my credit card statement just came and she charged me $2 more for tips. wtf? That's fraud!

Food was absolutely nasty. Everything was fried in lard and my throat was scratchy from all that oil. I asked for eggs over easy, and guess what? they broke the yolk! I really wanted to through it in her face, but had to work really hard to apply Confucious' anger management skills. argh!

Absolutely terrible experience. Don't ever go there!

Really nice staff and great service. The menu has lots of options. I just think it's a bit pricey compared to some other breakfast places that are similar. It's nearly $7 for just a 2 egg breakfast which is a bit excessive. Again, nice staff and I'd probably go back.

Every time my boyfriend and I come here we get amazing service and the food is the bomb. The restaurant is always clean and the staff makes you feel like family. Never have I come here and not liked everything about this place. A++

Definitely a good place to grab a quick breakfast. Also a decent meeting spot for business breakfasts and lunches. Personally, I think you can do better with the food but all around it is a bad joint.

I was desperately needing to get away from the strip. I couldn't take the cigarette smoke, or the need to resist cheap alcohol at every turn, or the expensive food. I really just wanted a quiet, peaceful gluten-free brunch before attending a family wedding. And we got just that. 

It was perfect weather outside when we came. There was a nice breeze and just the loveliest kiss of warmth from the sun. Service from all staff was welcoming and friendly. To top it off, they had a separate gluten-free/celiac-friendly menu! I was immediately drawn to the gluten-free pancakes, toast, and muffins. I got myself a delicious corned beef hash with a warm chocolate muffin! I couldn't be happier with my morning, especially when prices were under $10. 

I am glad to have a found a local breakfast joint that is not too far from the strip. Now I have a go-to gluten-free diner whenever in Vegas.
Visiting from California and wanted the local experience and we were pleased the food was made in house and delightful

This was my first time eating at The Cracked Egg and I must say it left a great impression on me. 

The hostess was very bland and straight forward. Although she wasn't rude, she wasn't very friendly either. Our waitress, Emily, was very friendly and attentive. 

Now to the food ... I ordered a "build your own skillet" with pastrami, bacon, mushrooms, bell peppers, spinach, & broccoli. It was AWESOME; filled flavor and was very appealing to the eyes. My wife ordered the two egg combo with a waffle and potatoes; instead of eggs. I thought her food look great; she said it tasted average. 

The eggs are definitely fresh but the potatoes are definitely from a bag. 

Overall, the atmosphere was good, the food was delicious, & the service was great!

Amazing waitstaff, Erin, being an outstanding waitress! The food was delicious. Don't leave without their coffee cake! The Joe's Scramble was spot-on--a recommendation from Erin. Wish we could take her back to Kansas with us!
I have been to the Cracked Egg twice now and it hasn't disappointed yet. A fun, simple and tasty breakfast. Both times I have gone have been on weekday mornings and the service is fast and efficient.
Service and food were both AMAZING! The food was all fresh and cooked to perfection, Cory was so sweet with us! We will be coming back next time we're in Vegas, for sure!
I always get the Taylor scramble cream cheese and green onins ...YUM!!!!

I had this place bookmarked for a while and we finally got a chance to try It!

There was no wait when we got there (Black Friday 8 am). We got seated and was immediately greeted and our drink orders were taken. Shortly after that our friendly server took our order. Within 5-8 mins our food came out. 

We ordered the homemade corned beef and the short stack chocolate chip pancakes (3 huge pancakes) for my kids to share.  

The corned beef wasn't anything like I expected...the corned beef was thinly stripped with diced peppers, onions and hash brown potatoes mixed together. It also came with hash browns and their homemade coffee cake. Their portions are big so I shared with my husband.

All in all, it was good, service was good. 

I would go back!

This is by far my favorite restaurant spot! 
The service is always friendly and the food is always delicious. 
I typically get the Joes Scramble. Its ground beef, eggs, scallions, cream cheese delicious doesn't even begin to cover it. Their potatoes are good and their coffee cake is to die for. 
This absolutely goes without saying I will be back!

This place is great! The service is quick and friendly, and the portions are huge. I ordered a soup and sandwich for lunch and the soup came in the biggest bowl I have ever seen. I was full before I even got to the sandwich! (But ate it anyways, I could never pass up a BLT)

I have been a few times now and they are always very accommodating with substitutions and special requests. The burgers and omelettes also have large portion sizes. I will definitely be returning!

This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in Vegas. Have been here for both breakfast and lunch. The servers are great and are always happy looking. To date I have tried the country Benni, homemade corned beef hash, the Mexican skillet, the enchilada omelette, chicken fried steak, Reuben, patty melt, bleu cheese bacon burger, and the open faced chili burger. The chili is excellent. The homemade corned beef hash was a bit disappointing. My go to favorite is the country Benni. Breakfast on the weekends is a bit of a wait.

Wow, this place is great.  I was looking for some place for my sisters, friends and I to meet up with a relative that was near our hotel.  The Cracked Egg showed up on my google search, and I'm so glad it did.

We got there shortly after 9 on a Saturday morning with 6 people.  It took about ~20 minutes to seat us, which was expected.  I had looked over the menu while waiting, so by the time we sat down I knew what I wanted.  In fact, as soon as I saw it on the menu I didn't even have to keep looking.  Peanut butter stuffed french toast drizzled with bananas and honey.  This was one of my most favorite breakfasts ever.  It was like heaven on a plate!

All of the food we got was really good.  2 of the people I was with got coffee cake with their breakfasts, and boy was I jealous!  The type of coffee cake varies by whatever pan happens to come out of the oven, and they ended up with peach.  It was moist and warm and so good.

Breakfasts ordered:  Eggs Benedict, Monte Cristo, bacon cheeseburger skillet, and at least one other thing that I don't remember because I didn't taste it.  Everything was good.  I'm glad I got to taste a little bit of eveything, because they were all delicious.  I still stand by my decision of the peanut butter french toast.  yummy!  I can't wait until next Sept. when I'll be out there again for a repeat trip!

I have never had a bad meal nor a bad server here. Reasonably priced and delicious coffee cake. ALWAYS GET THE COFFEE CAKE! It changes daily and I pour some coffee over it and really enjoy before my entree arrives. My fiance and I often get the cornbeef and hash as well as the chicken fried steak and eggs and then share with each other.  Seriously my favorite breakfast place in town. There are plenty of options for lunch though I can never seem to get passed my favorites. I have tried a bite of other family members meals. The eggs Benedict and traditional French toast they ordered were enjoyed by all! Good portion size too.
Great place to get food quality breakfast food for a great price. Off the strip so there aren't any touristy people. Just a good local spot to get stuffed!

First off, I am very dedicated customer of this establishment. I've been going to Cracked Egg for quite a long time, and tend to frequent it 2-3x a week.

 This past Sunday, there was an approximate 15-20 minute wait for a table, which considering it's a Sunday morning is not surprising. After waiting for about 12 minutes or so, this woman and her two teenage kids comes in and puts her name down.....only to be seated in front of everyone else one minute later. I said something to the host, who responded, "Yeah, that shouldn't happen." and DID NOTHING. I was so infuriated that I stormed out of the restaurant and have vowed not to come back. 

I find that extremely rude and unprofessional and completely disrespectful to ALL the other customers waiting like everyone else.
Love coming to the cracked egg. Generous delicious portions. The coffee cake is such a bonus!!
Very very good service...wait time was short and well worth it...so good went back with friends the next morning! Different server same great place

COFFEE CAKE!!!!

It's the best here. I love that they change flavors of coffee cake here and there. I once had pumpkin coffee cake last fall and it was amazing! This Cracked Egg is better than other locations. The service is always great and quick!

For some reason I did not know that the owner was one of the original owners of Egg Works that branched off mutually and independently. Sorry to compare but the potatoes are just not as crack like as Egg Works. They are still very yummy though. 

I normally just get the sausage, eggs and potatoes which sets me back $7.95. My hubby always gets one of the skillets which is always way too much food! Leftovers!

My only gripe is the lack of alcohol. There is none. I am a night-shifter so breakfast is like my dinner and I love me some mimosas..

They have, by far, the best coffee cake I have ever had. I seriously could have just eaten that for my breakfast, and ditched the omelet. However, the chorizo in the omelet could have been stronger, but it was still a good omelet. The seasoned home fries were also good. Even though this place is a bit off the strip, it was worth the trip.
Best breakfast in the world. Great staff. Great prices. Enough said.

Come hungry. Just what you would imagine a home-style breakfast should be, with portions a plenty.  I'm a corned beef hash fan, except when it comes from a can (which is how most places serve it.)  This really is made from scratch and delicious. My partner had oatmeal which seemed a little pricey at first. But when we saw the size and all the fresh add-ins (served on the side) we saw it was worth it. Even better, this wasn't 1 minute instant oats.

-coffee cake is baaaaging! 
-massive protein
-easily can eat clean here
-way too many things to choose from (good thing) 
-strong 4.5!

4 1/2  stars
