I went to this place with my son and my husband.  The place was packed!! I had never felt more uncomfortable in any other place I have been to.  I had never experienced someone treating me differently because of the language I spoke.  I was speaking to my son in spanish when the waitress came up and she rolled her eyes.  I asked her if she had a problem and she was like "no, what are you going to order?", I ignored it and ordered some food.  By the time it got there my son was getting antsy and all the staff ( the waitress, hostess, manager) were looking at us.  I asked the waitress to wrap up the food to go cause I hate listening to children cry when Im eating and Im sure other people do to, so I was going to leave.  The manager came up and asked if there was a problem and I said no that my son was just antsy, the waitress and hostess laughing in the background looking at us.  I then said to the manager how uncomfortable it was how everyone was treating us.  He followed by saying  'I don"t believe they would do that, I wouldn't allow it."  I said "I am not asking you if you believe me or not I am telling you what happened".  Long story short, we left.  The food I ate in the car sucked, seriously not just cause I was upset.  I have ordered food to go from mimmy's for breakfast and it kicked ass this was just bland!  I would recommend Denny's over this place.

So I really love this place!!!!  I come for the jalapeño bacon,  I also get ice coffee and there creamers are so good but the best part of coming here is...my suprise.  Everything I order I get coffee cake and it changes constantly so it's like a suprise, my special suprise...and they are always delicious  
#crackedegg #coffeecake #breakfast

Good god this food was GOOD! Only a slight wait when we got there in the late morning for breakfast on a Saturday morning, but the food was SO worth it.  Not big on service, but that's not why you go here.  I LOVED the extensive Gluten Free Menu and was thrilled to death.  One of the only GF options for breakfasts I've ever been to and I was so excited to find one while we were in Vegas on vacation! Would definitely recommend and return each and every time we go back! A ways away from the strip though, drive, as the taxi will be $$!

Ok,  I'm irritated.  I eat here once or twice a week and have nothing but good things to say about the food and the service. I asked for a little salsa to put on my scramble and I get a little,  maybe 2 ounce cup of salsa.  Nothing special,  just to add a little flavor.  I get the bill and its $1.50 for this little bit of salsa.  Fine,  if you want to charge for it,  then say something! And I can see 50 cents or something,  but $1.50? And just slipping it on the bill without saying anything? Come on.  I don't own why this irritated me so much,  but it did.  I just looked at my receipt from last week when my girlfriend and I went and we both got little salsas, and sure enough, $3! Not cool

HISTORY/DISCOVERY
I discovered I was gluten-intolerant this past year and it has made eating out difficult, especially when most of my favorite foods have become my worst enemies: bread,  pancakes, waffles, pasta, etc. With this current news I have been on a hunt for GLUTEN FREE items, and The Cracked Egg is a stellar winner!

The gluten free pancakes and other available options here allow me to order my favorite meals and enjoy a quality breakfast meal. The gluten free pancakes here are DELICIOUS and taste like the real deal. The omelet was very good and they even accommodate gluten free toast, which also, verrry good! Solid selection on the menu.

4STARS
the only thing preventing this from being 5stars for me is the extra charge for gluten free is a little steep. Sucks to pay extra for having allergies, but I really appreciate the availability and the service we had was really excellent. Waitress was very sweet, helpful, and courteous. Experience was flawless, pricing was a little high.

This is your typical greasy american style grill diner breakfast place.  Given that there are no other close breakfast place, you take what you can get, but it is still a disappointment given all the other rave reviews.

Let me start with the coffee cake.  Please don't order this.  It is made with a generic white cake mix that is not even very good mixed in with some cinnamon mix and white frosting.  Actually, it is pretty gross to eat for breakfast.  

You know there is a question of quality when all of the menu items are put in "quotations".  Enjoy the "Fresh-squeezed" OJ as long as you realize it may be fresh squeezed, but it is the worst quality and cheapest OJ they apparently could get their hands on.  We had a variety of breakfast items including french toast, pancakes and some special "hash" item that is supposed to be a specialty.  I wouldn't order any of it again.  

On a positive note the service was excellent and someone in our party got a hamburger (for breakfast??) but at least I can say everyone at our table really enjoyed the french fries.

Again, at a minimum please DO NOT order the coffee cake, some of the worst breakfast sweets I have ever had anywhere.

Good Food, a bit over priced I feel for what you actually get not by much though.  Always very busy though.   Food is consistant.  Nothing amazing but a nice breakfeast place, probobly have to wait if you go on the weekend morning though

First time here. Decided to yelp breakfast after our Red Rock hike. This breakfast/lunch spot is amazing with great customer service. Corey treated us so well great service. I ordered the bacon, cheese, avacado omelet which was delightful. I also made sure to order the coffee cake which was highly recommend on yelp ITS A MUST TRY. HAPPY EATING ENJOY.
Great selection great service and most of all very tasty food from breakfast to lunch items I will defiantly come back next time am in town

Great service, delicious food. I love their menu - they have a huge variety of dishes, for meat eaters and veggies alike. Not just typical diner fare but fun stuff with chiles, protein focus, etc. the Cracked Egg even offers coffee cake instead of toast - they deserve all the props because of it. Yum!
Just, no. Go to Egg Works. Everything but the coffee cake was gross. The coffe cake was awsome.

I'm not a morning person, period, but all this week I've had to get up at 4:30am. Today, I decided to come here because I doubt I'd have another perfect chance. Upon entry, I had to wait a few minutes before I was acknowledged. I asked for the patio because it was early and it wouldn't be so hot (this was about 8:20am).

The hostess was polite, sure, but nothing super friendly. Oh, EVEN BETTER!@ The waitress! Omg, she came with her notepad and asked for my order, the end. I thought she had a grudge against me or something. I got my check super fast so I also felt like she wanted me to leave asap. She asked if I needed a box when she gave me my check so I don't know if I looked like I was ready to leave or if she was mad that I got the patio and she had to walk out to check up on me or something.

The food was decent; the portions were big (for me). I got 3 sausage links (they also come in patties) and lots of hash browns and my 2 eggs. They also offer you the seasoned potatoes if you don't want the hash browns. You also get another side and I chose the coffee cake. It was bitter, but not that shabby.

I signed up for their loyalty card in case I ever needed it. Maybe I'll try another location to check up on service. This third lady (I got helped by 3 people total) looked like she was the owner or manager or someone of that level. She was much more friendly and she processed my loyalty card and gave me points for it without me asking for it since I had forgotten about handing the card over to my waitress.

Overall, I hope I get better service if I get the chance to eat here again.

Great breakfast place for the price. I reserve 5 stars for only the best of the best. But you can't go wrong here for your straight up classic breakfast dishes. 

I got the GVP omelette huevos rancheros style with re fried beans and salsa. 

Even the waitress was like: Damn. That's a good order. 

;)

Had brunch at the cracked egg and it was great! Came in and had to wait about five mins or so for a booth since it was busy. After getting seated we ordered drinks and skimmed through the menu. Thanks to Yelp pictured I already knew what to get. My daughter got their waffle with berries and I got their croissant French toast. While waiting for the food we noticed the decoration. It's pretty homey if you ask me. Sort of a model home type of design to lure you in. The food came shortly and it was tasty. Nothing super amazing but it did hit the spot! Oh and if you have an entertainment coupon book don't forget to use their buy one get one free ticket.

This place is always awesome for breakfast, i have a wonderful experience every time i go. Their coffee is pretty decent, and you can even ask for flavored creamers. The food is always fresh, and the portion of avocado given when you ask for a side makes me happy. Even on busy days we can get seated very quickly and they servers are usually pretty good at attending to our needs! Their kitchens are pretty quick so you don't usually have to wait for very long to get your food after ordering.

The Cracked Egg is THE BEST breakfast place in town. I've been coming here for the past 8 yrs or so and the staff is always on point. The fresh yellow carnation flowers on the table give it a friendly welcoming feeling as when you visit your friends house who lives out in the countryside. The food! The food always exceeds my expectations. I have NEVER been disappointed with any plate I have ever ordered and I'm the type of person who ends up ordering the same dish at a particular restaurant because I hate to feel disappointed with my order. I don't have to worry about that when I eat here. Chili skillet is my absolute favorite, but the Chile Verde is bomb! Stuffed avocado is delish, monte Christi is sweet and savory mixed to a perfection. 
A must visit restaurant that will keep you coming back for more!

There's a lot of potential for this place to have four stars, and I just might have to up my review the next time around when I return here and browse through the variety of breakfast items this place truly has. While I did arrive with a large group one Sunday morning and the wait was nearly 35-45 minutes for us, they did their best to accommodate us in the same section near each other.

I went with the veggie skillet, might I add was very tasty (I was able to get choice of how my eggs were cooked, as well as toast to go with). It was delicious, and what I thought was a "healthy alternative" probably wasn't because of the excessive amount of cheese that was packed into it (not to say I don't love cheese, but next time I'll be sure to request to tone it down a little more).

This location was extremely busy the Sunday morning I went, and because of such the service did take longer than usual. While I won't hold the service against that because it was busy (and knowing how that gets from working in a restaurant industry), I'd definitely like to return here to see what else there is to try.
Went to mario batali's @ the palazzo the night before and this place whipped his ass.  The food was awesome and out of the kitchen in about 4 minutes.
It was fine.  As a rule, I am suspect of places that purport to "smother" anything in sauce.  The staff was great, though, and the place is very clean.
Very homey atmosphere with great country style cooking. Our waitress Erin was awesome, quick, personable with a great personality!

Great food, friendly service, but I can't give them five stars because of their prices.  For the food and portions, I truly feel they are overpriced.  I am a frequent diner and I do have my favorite items, but I tend to visit when I, or someone in my party has a coupon because of the prices. There are several businesses close-by and they don't offer any type of corporate discounts, which is surprising.  I think if they added this "perk' their business would get crazy busy.  Overall, I have no complaints about the food or service, and I recently brought my family from out of town in to enjoy an outstanding breakfast here.

I will start by saying that our party of 2 was sat very quick on a busy Father's Day. Our drink orders were taken right away but we sat for a while before any one took our order.

The place was packed and there were screaming kids everywhere. Our server was very friendly but the food was pretty bad. My husband compared it to cafeteria food. I agree that it seemed like typical Las Vegas food that you would get at a local video poker bar or casino cafe.

We ordered breakfast by the way. Steak and eggs and the croissant sandwich.

Its was the Saturday before Mothers day and my Florist still needed an hour to finish my order so I walked across the parking lot to the Cracked Egg.

It was late morning/very early afternoon and the place was packed. The entrance isn't designed too well as today you had to wade through a crowd to get to the register and ask to be seated or put your name on a list. When its time to go you have to wade through that same crowd to pay and then again to exit.  I know bars/clubs put in focal points to force patrons to mingle with eachother or to create the appearance of the place seeming "hot"  I just didnt appreciate the experience this early and espically to get a couple over easy eggs.  Simply stated the store is just to small for a restaurant this popular.

The food wasn't bad but my Mexican/Jalapeño dish was lacking in flavor and that is impressive as you really have to work hard to kill the flavor of a Jalapeño.

The service was pleasant enough but once my food was delivered I didn't see my waitress a single time (she gave me my check with the food) and nobody else stopped by to check on my 3/4 empty soda so it was a good thing my jalapeños weren't spicy or flavourful.

I love this franchise but would recommend going on a non rush/less busy time so you can enjoy your food prepared with all the spices and ingredients they deserve and not be ignored.

Parking was a little tight as well. The store is located in a business plaza and not designed for easy in and out or for large hungry crowds.

We had breakfast here during our recent trip to LV and it was so amazing.  I had the eggs, cooked perfectly and biscuits and gravy also wonderful. But first came the  little bit of heaven warm coffee cake.  If I lived here I would eat here all of the time.  The waitress was very friendly and very prompt with refills. The Orange juice was the tastiest . I have heard the wait time is usually lengthy but we went during the week  and got seated quickly.  This breakfast tasted like a good old fashioned southern breakfast.  Yummy.
I love grabbing brunch at cracked egg with family. It has a great family setting and good food!

This is one of my favorite breakfast places. I think the food is amazing and menu options are very creative.  I do hate the long wait.  Do try their coffee cake and delicious omelettes.  I give this place stars for creativity and food.

The cracked egg is my favorite new breakfast spot. I love all the options, you can order just about any egg plate your mind can think up. I love the southwestern green chili scrambles. Their daily complimentary coffee cake is amazing, I especially love the peach.

I. Love. The Cracked Egg.

It's such a cute little breakfast/lunch stop! You can never go wrong with a home-y feeling restaurant! I usually come here with my boyfriend for breakfast. They're always busy but we usually get sat within 15-20 minutes. People are in and out! I am always greeted with awesome service and the vibe is such a family and home-y atmosphere. I really enjoy getting the nutella stuffed smores french toast. TO. DIE. FOR. I've probably gotten it like 5 or 6 times already! They also have some of the best seasoned potatoes in town. One of my absolute favorites! I also really like their omelets. They're super hot and fresh and you can make them however you want or they have a few you can choose from. I like The Denver! I've also had their skillets, DELISH! I always have a hard time choosing what I want to get. I want to try their whole menu because everything looks so good! Eventually I will be able to get to that point, but for now I have stuck with what I know is truly my favorite. The french toast. Go ahead, try it! You won't be disappointed!

The food is good, but the crowd is out of control.  It's a wait to get in and you feel crammed in.  There are way to many tables in this little joint.  The service comes around as fast as they can, but if you look spanish (which I do even though I'm not Spanish at all) you may wait a while.  

I thought it was just me, but I see that someone else has had the feeling that they are not wanted there.  I got a few looks at first, but when the waitress came and spoke to me and my vocab was better then hers I got better treatment.

Anyway, the food was okay.  No better then any Denny's or IHOP I've ever been too.  You have more room to eat, a quieter meal, and better service at IHOP.  Sorry, but it's the truth.

But if you like a room filled with noisy loud people(Like high school cafateria loud), this is the place for you.

We make special trips here when staying in Vegas.  Particularly love the corned beef hash and chile verde rancheros.  For the most part it is typical breakfast fair, just done better than most other places.

I only ever seem to end up at the Cracked Egg with a coupon in hand. The breakfasts are always solid. Not my favorite in town, but they have quite a bit of variety and it's all pretty good. 

I have tried a number of things over the years and I tend to prefer their savories to sweets. Coffee cake isn't my thing, so despite all the raves, I have never ordered it more than once. The omelets usually draw my attention and they are good and cooked to order. Service is friendly, but the restaurant gets pretty busy so be prepared to wait or arrive early on weekends.

None of the dishes have stood out over the years, but if you're looking for a basic breakfast stop, this is as good a place as any, just make sure you have a coupon.

My go to place for breakfast in Las Vegas.  Good prices, good food, and most importantly for a place with this name, good eggs.  Nice quiet area and right off the highway.  Even with construction on the road, it is still easy to get to.

After being there again, everything I said before is confirmed and I will be back again.  Great food!

At the end of our Vegas trip, we wanted a decent breakfast spot away from the strip because all the good ones around the area were packed. This place was recommended, so we decided to check this modern breakfast spot out. I only wish that this place was closer to the strip. I guess that's why it was so easy to find a table to fit our group of 6 right away.

Food:
1) Coffee Cake was fantastic! The coffee cake here deserves 5 Stars. It was freshly baked, soft, moist, and perfectly sweet. I would actually make a pit stop here just for this if I'm driving to and from Vegas
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2?select=6Nzg1wAdBviOQNXVmfXlkg#oZXMxk_GLSoepyhkWveiJQ

2) Country Benny - Biscuit split and topped with patty sausage, two poached eggs, and smothered in gravy. I liked the gravy because it was flavorful and had a good consistency (not too watery or too thick). The eggs were poached well and the seasoned potatoes were so good! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2?select=6Nzg1wAdBviOQNXVmfXlkg#V-3L8nJ43gnSCuKv08V0wQ

3) Sausage and Eggs were pretty standard thick links with eggs and seasoned potatoes. It was good, but nothing special. You could probably buy the same links at a market and make it yourself.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2?select=6Nzg1wAdBviOQNXVmfXlkg#fbjiuYm9Je2vHxb9QXLOaw

Service:
The servers were very nice and checked on us regularly to see how we were doing. You actually have to go up to the front to pay, which I found to be pretty inconvenient.

Came here with the Misses. Was packed but wait was only 5 mins. Has the corned beef hash and the coffee cake. Food was super legit. Server was hella friendly and the atmosphere is easy going. Will most definitely come back.

I normally don't have high standards when it comes to breakfast places because I've had quite a few mishaps with them. For starters, they're always busy with long waits for so-so flavors. If I had to go through that again, I'd skip to the next breakfast joint. 

Now the interesting part about The Cracked Egg is their presentation. It's traditional, welcoming and friendly to say the least. Many of the entrees there seems like something you can get at other competition yet I feel like they can execute it better. First, I had the pleasure to try their Joe's Scramble. This consisted of Three Eggs scrambled with Seasoned Ground Beef, Spinach, Cream Cheese, Scallions and Jack & Cheddar Cheese. The moment I read ground beef, I was sold. Unlike other breakfast places, they make their eggs so it's not overcooked. That's my favorite part because I start to get pretty upset when scrambled eggs are poorly made. 

You also have a choice to toast and coffee cake. Choose the coffee cake. You'll thank me later. The cake tasted almost like angel cake offering soft and fluffy bites to them. Delicious to say the least and this was probably the highlight of my stay. But it doesn't stop there; it's served warm with bits of peach because they know good food. Is it possible to have two servings of that?? 

The service was great as our server continued to ask how we were doing. The food was long either because after a few minutes of ordering, I was already downing the most amazing coffee cake I've had the pleasure in eating :P 

Also, there's no wifi there which made me appreciate the ambiance a lot more! Written on a placard states, "no wifi, pretend it's like the 1940s and socialize." Okay, I'm pretty sure that's not what it said. It you get the idea. Nonetheless, it was bittersweet. 

Now the question is, would I come back? Heck yeah! No wait and good food? Who can beat that?
